subject: Chairman's Update: June 11th
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
June 11, 2020
This is a new weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good morning, Pennsylvania.
With everything happening around our country, it is more important than ever that we unite and uplift one another across this great Commonwealth. Unfortunately, Governor Tom Wolf has done the opposite and has defied his own ‚Äústay at home‚Äù order to stand shoulder to shoulder with people holding ‚ÄúBLUE LIVES MURDER‚Äù signs.
This is a level of hypocrisy I cannot wrap my head around.
As Gov. Wolf contradicts his own policies, our Republican leaders continue to let their actions speak for themselves. This is why we developed a weekly update. To show that while our statewide Democratic leadership continues to fail us, our Republican leaders are standing up for Pennsylvanians of all walks of life. Contribute now to help us gear up and get more Republicans elected this fall.
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
DONATE NOW
#### Thank you, Speaker Turzai!
ICYMI, Speaker Mike Turzai announced he will retire from the PA House of Representatives after nearly 20 years of public service. We are saddened to see him go and grateful for his years of leadership within the Pennsylvania Legislature.
At the PAGOP, we released a statement Wednesday thanking Speaker Turzai for his service. Here is a brief overview:
‚ÄúI would like to thank my friend Speaker Turzai for his many years of dutiful service to the 28th House District and the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania,‚Äù said Lawrence Tabas, Chairman of the Republican Party of Pennsylvania.
"His five plus years as Speaker have been some of the most productive the Pennsylvania Legislature has seen.
"The entire Commonwealth owes him a debt of gratitude for his tireless work to reopen Pennsylvania. But what I will remember most about his work, is his dedication to his colleagues.
"Speaker Turzai's impact on the Republican Party and the PA House of Representatives will be felt for years to come in young members he has mentored and helped win elections.‚Äù
‚Üí Watch this: House Speaker Turzai's staff takes to Twitter to use his platform to share a heartening message (Twitter)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
# Meet our statewide candidates
Now that our state primary is over, it is time for us to look ahead to the General Election. Meet our statewide candidates who need your support heading into November.
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
# Attorney General Shapiro refuses to take a stand
Our Republican-endorsed candidate for attorney general, Heather Heidelbaugh, called on sitting Attorney General Josh Shapiro to take an affirmative stand on law enforcement. Heidelbaugh cited Shapiro‚Äôs concerning silence as his Democratic Party moves closer and closer to the mainstream idea of abolishing police forces. It is Shapiro‚Äôs duty to work hand in hand with the law and support our police officers. Will he side with his Democratic Party or will step up and take his job seriously?
‚ÄúI believe an effective and fair police force is crucial for our safety and liberty. As Attorney General, I would oppose these radical, left-wing efforts and work with all communities to ensure that our streets are safe,‚Äù said Heidelbaugh.
All lives matter; regardless of race, ethnicity, income OR occupation.
‚Üí Read more: Attorney General Josh Shapiro owes Pennsylvanians an answer on defunding and abolishing the police (Twitter)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### U.S. Senator Toomey takes on Chinese Communist Party
Senator Toomey visited Erie and Washington County Friday with Rep. Guy Reschenthaler and Rep. Mike Kelly, along with State Senator Dan Laughlin, to talk with local business owners about how they were affected by the statewide shutdown.
U.S. Senator Toomey has been a staunch defender of Hong Kong‚Äôs freedom, by recently co-sponsoring the bipartisan Hong Kong Autonomy Act. This act pushes against Communist China‚Äôs aggression
On the 31st anniversary of the Tiananmen Square protests, Sen. Toomey called on Congress to hold Communist China accountable for its interference with Hong Kong‚Äôs independence. This comes after Sen. Toomey introduced the Hong Kong Autonomy Act, which is bipartisan legislation designed to push back on Communist China‚Äôs aggression.
‚Üí Watch here: Senator Toomey‚Äôs opening remarks to the Senate Banking Committee hearing on U.S. policy towards Hong Kong (YouTube)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Senate President Scarnati and Speaker Turzai join Republican leaders in raising concerns over Gov. Wolf‚Äôs executive order
Senate President Pro Tempore Joe Scarnati issued a joint statement with Speaker of the House Mike Turzai, Senate Majority Leader Jake Corman and House Majority Leader Bryan Cutler regarding Governor Wolf‚Äôs decision to extend ballot deadlines.
‚ÄúFree and fair elections mean that one person cannot change the rules at the 11th hour. Pure and simple.
‚ÄúThe General Assembly was not consulted or advised of this order. ‚ÄòWorking together‚Äô has to be more than a talking point.
‚ÄúThe founding fathers established a system with checks and balances. Even in an emergency, the General Assembly has an obligation to protect our citizens while defending our democracy.
‚ÄúWe are working with our counsel to determine what steps are available to ensure the people‚Äôs trust in the election process is solidified.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Speaker Turzai: Americans demand justice (PA House of Representatives)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### A Piece of Positivity
‚Üí Bipartisanship at its finest. ü§ù Pa. lawmakers approved a resolution ending Wolf‚Äôs coronavirus emergency declaration. Next up: a legal battle. (Philadelphia Inquirer)
Share Share

Forward Forward

subject: Chairman's Update October 23rd
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
October 23, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
The Pennsylvania Supreme Court ruled that ballots can be accepted up to three days after Election Day. The Republican Party opposed this at every turn but lost in a 4-4 ruling. This only highlights the importance of having a full Supreme Court this November. Democrats understand the importance of Pennsylvania in this race, so they are championing the new election rules. The Pennsylvania Republican Party will not give up on ensuring our elections are fair and trusted.
Republican state leaders summarized this moment: ‚ÄúThe new rules imposed by the decision of the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania (a body elected in partisan elections) could destroy the American public‚Äôs confidence in the electoral system as a whole.‚Äù PA voters need to come out and vote to assure fraud does not win, but your choice does.
‚Üí Read More: High court allows 3-day extension for Pennsylvania ballots (NBC12)
‚Üí Read More: GOP looks to keep fighting against late-arriving mail ballots in Pennsylvania (The Wenatchee World)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Governor Wolf is killing the restaurant industry üëé
Governor Wolf‚Äôs restrictions are killing the restaurant and bar industry. Restaurant owners urged the PA Legislature to override Gov. Wolf‚Äôs veto of House Bill 2513. This bill would have set the minimum restaurant capacity to 50%. It would also allow people to sit at bars and eliminate the requirement to purchase a meal to have an alcoholic beverage. Unfortunately, they did have enough votes to override Gov. Wolf. This is why PA voters must vote red up and down the ballot, so we can stop Gov. Wolf from destroying our economy.
Hospitality is the state‚Äôs second-largest industry and Gov. Wolf is choosing to play politics with peoples‚Äô livelihoods. Restaurant business owner Matt Flinchbaugh pleaded, ‚ÄúOur businesses, the lifeblood of our local communities, struggle to make it after the governor imposed new restrictions on our operations.‚Äù Ironically enough, Gov. Wolf visited Pittsburgh Thursday as a supposed effort to ‚Äúsupport the restaurant and bar industry.‚Äù Give me a break. It is clear he does not support the restaurant and bar industry, or else he would have supported House Bill 2513.
‚Üí Read more: Restaurant owners seek override of Gov. Wolf‚Äôs veto of restriction-loosening bill (PennLive)
‚Üí Read more: Gov. Wolf vetoes Pa. restaurant bill, advocate groups ask General Assembly to override veto (York Daily Record)
#### Senator Toomey praises the EPA üôå
Senator Toomey wrote an op-ed on the great balance of the Environmental Protection Agency's actions. The EPA has worked toward a cleaner environment without hurting American and Pennsylvanian jobs. He gives the example of the EPA‚Äôs Great Lakes Restoration Initiative (GLRI). In 2013, Erie's Presque Isle Bay was wrongly removed from the ‚ÄúAreas of Concern‚Äù list. Under the Trump Administration, it has gained the attention necessary to combat the Bay's contamination growth.
Meanwhile, the radical left promotes the Green New Deal and other crushing regulations on American workers. Most importantly, a Biden-Harris administration could lead to a ban on fracking, which would crush PA‚Äôs economy. Our country needs four more years of commonsense policies to keep our environment clean and our jobs secure.
‚Üí Read more: Pat Toomey: EPA takes commonsense approach under President Trump (Go Erie)
#### GOP candidates sue for fair elections üëä
Congressional GOP candidates Sean Parnell (PA-17) and Luke Negron (PA-18) filed a lawsuit seeking to allow poll watchers at the satellite election offices in Allegheny County. Just as on Election Day, these candidates believe that poll watchers should be at the satellite election offices. Their attorneys cited that Allegheny County had to reissue corrected ballots to voters after nearly 30,000 received incorrect ballots. Parnell noted, ‚ÄúAt its core, our lawsuit is about ensuring that the rights of ALL voters are protected heading into this crucially important election.‚Äù
We need accountability to make sure ballots are not stuffed or other illegal activities at these satellite sites for both parties. This is where people vote, thus poll watchers should be present. This should not be a partisan issue, yet the Democrats are against poll watchers being at these sites.
Our elections must be fair and these candidates will try to ensure that every vote counts.
‚Üí Read here: Congressional candidates Sean Parnell and Luke Negron file lawsuit to allow poll watchers at Allegheny Co. satellite election offices (KDKA)
‚Üí Watch here: Parnell and Negron interview with Wendy Bell (Facebook)
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Read this: Senate Judiciary Committee confirms Judge Barrett! (Fox News
# Meet our statewide candidates:
President Donald J. Trump President Donald J. Trump
Heather Heidelbaugh for Attorney General Heather Heidelbaugh for Attorney General
Stacy Garrity for Treasurer Stacy Garrity for State Treasurer

subject: Chairman's Update September 4th
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
September 4, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
It‚Äôs been a busy week here in Pennsylvania with visits from President Trump, Vice President Mike Pence, and Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden. Friends, it‚Äôs pretty clear the great Commonwealth of Pennsylvania is key to this 2020 election and we are ready for four more years of President Trump!
President Trump and Vice President Pence called upon each one of us to help win the fight against the radical socialist agenda of a Biden-Harris administration. PA stands with our men and women in blue and we stand for the American flag. These are not radical ideas, they are American ideas. Join us in this critical fight friends, the country needs Pennsylvania to go red this November.
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Gov. Wolf won‚Äôt let go of the power üëä
Governor Wolf extended Pennsylvania‚Äôs Disaster Emergency Declaration that was set to expire September 1st. Gov. Wolf has another 90 days to enjoy the extra executive powers. House Republicans already attempted to end this power grab, but lost in the courts. Unfortunately, this can mean more restrictions on businesses and schools.
House GOP spokesman Jason Gottesman sharply criticized the governor, ‚ÄúGovernor Wolf has ignored the law and acted by fiat for the last six months. It is curious now that he is searching for the limits of his authority as an excuse to pass the buck to the General Assembly over the crisis he created for both property owners and renters.‚Äù
Gov. Wolf refuses to release crippling restrictions harming thousands of Pennsylvanians. Instead of staying in his executive lane, he wants to be the legislator too. Republicans will continue to fight against Gov. Wolf‚Äôs power grabs.
‚Üí Read more: Gov. Wolf the new legislator? (PennLive)
#### PA State Republicans fight against Democratic schemes
The Legislature is back in session and the Pennsylvania Republican officials have their hands full fighting Democrats‚Äô schemes. Republicans attempted to override Governor Wolf‚Äôs veto on ending his disaster emergency declaration, but it wasn‚Äôt enough. PA House Majority Leader Kerry Benninghoff did not mince his words, ‚Äú[Gov. Wolf is] behaving like he‚Äôs been given a blank check of authority, the governor and his administration have continued to act alone, issuing confusing and inconsistent orders, guidance, recommendations and/or mandates, depending on what term you want to use that day.‚Äù The GOP is not done with exposing Wolf and his cohorts‚Äô schemes that continue to hurt Pennsylvanians through excessive restrictions.
Rep. Benninghoff finds himself in yet another battle over PA‚Äôs election process for the 2020 elections. Republicans passed a bill Wednesday despite Democrat opposition, however, Gov. Wolf said he will not sign it. In sum, it outlaws the use of ballot drop boxes and it moves the deadline to apply for a mail-in-ballot to 15 days before the election. Rep. Benninghoff assures Pennsylvanians, ‚ÄúWhat this bill does is it provides access while ensuring the integrity and privacy of the voting process.‚Äù The bill is off to the state senate and will surely face more scrutiny from Democrats and the governor.
‚Üí Read more: Benninghoff leads the way against Wolf (Morning Call)
‚Üí Read more: Fair election reform bill (ErieNews)
#### VP Pence ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Trump Country Now‚Äù
Joe Biden also made an appearance attempting to change his party‚Äôs narrative on fracking and claim to be a moderate. Joe thinks he can lie to Pennsylvanians but we know the radical left pulls his strings. Biden did a great job reminding Pennsylvanians of the failed leadership from Democratic mayors and governors during Covid-19 and the destructive riots.
President Trump fires up the Latrobe crowd, reiterating just how important this 2020 election is for our state and country. He vowed his administration will bring back the economy hit by Covid-19. For Pennsylvania, President Trump reminded us, ‚ÄúJoe Biden spent the last 47 years shipping Pennsylvania jobs to China and foreign nations, and I‚Äôve spent the last four years bringing them back home. I ended the last administration‚Äôs eight year pure war on Pennsylvania oil and coal and fracking.‚Äù Joe Biden is a disaster for Pennsylvania.
VP Pence spoke at the ‚ÄúWorkers for Trump‚Äù with an upbeat and positive attitude about Pennsylvania jobs, unlike Joe. VP Pence teased, ‚ÄúI know we're not too far from our opponent's boyhood home but it's Trump country now," Pence said. "I'm here for one reason and one reason only, because Pennsylvania and America need four more years of President Donald Trump." Let‚Äôs show him PA is truly Trump country this November!
‚Üí Watch here: Vice President Mike Pence‚Äôs speech (C-Span)
‚Üí Watch here: President Trump fires up the PA crowd! (The Hill)
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Watch this: Our men and women in blue are heroes!! (Fox News)

subject: Chairman's Update August 24th
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
August 24, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
PAGOP Chairman Lawerence Tabas at the 2020 RNC convention in [[URL REDACTED]] afternoon I am coming to you live from the Republican National Convention in Charlotte, North Carolina. I am honored to be here representing the great Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. I had the opportunity to speak with Fox News about the extensive health precautions the RNC has in place at this year‚Äôs convention.
In little time, the RNC worked to modify the convention in accordance with Covid-19 health and safety standards. The hard work and determination behind this year‚Äôs convention exemplifies the energy the Republican Party is bringing into November. I am beyond proud to be a part of this organization.
‚Üí Read more: RNC delegates head for in-person roll call under strict precautions: Swabs, mandatory masks, all-day health desk (Fox News)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Someone Tell Mayor Peduto That the Left Can Never be Pleased üôÑ
We love when left-wing radical intolerance comes full circle. Pittsburgh‚Äôs ultra-liberal mayor, Bill Peduto, is finally getting a taste of his own medicine.
Mayor Peduto has always been incessantly anti-police. From calling on major budget cuts to the Pittsburgh police -- to having zero support for our Pennsylvania State Troopers -- our men and women in blue know they can‚Äôt trust Mayor Peduto to support them.
Now, Bill Peduto‚Äôs trusted left-wing base is attacking him for not completely defunding the police after a protester's arrest was made in Oakland last Saturday. Radical leftists showed up to Mayor Peduto‚Äôs house calling for his resignation. Guess who Bill Peduto called to disperse these ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù protesters from his house? That‚Äôs right, the police. Mayor Peduto, we have a message for you: The intolerant left can NEVER be pleased!
‚Üí Read more: Angry crowd shows up at Mayor Peduto‚Äôs home challenging Pittsburgh police arrest of protester (TRIBLive)
#### Sen. Toomey is Certified Animal Friendly ‚úÖ
Senator Toomey was named 2019‚Äôs ‚ÄòLegislator of the Year‚Äô by the Humane Society of the United States. Sen. Toomey scored this annual title from the Humane Society due to his efforts sponsoring -- and unanimously passing -- the Prevent Animal Cruelty and Torture (PACT) Act.
‚ÄúI'm honored to receive the HSUS Pennsylvania Legislator of the Year award,‚Äù said Sen. Toomey. ‚ÄúThe Humane Society of the United States is a great partner and played an integral role in the multi-year fight to get the landmark PACT Act across the goal line.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Humane Society names Senator Pat Toomey "Legislator of the Year" ([[URL REDACTED]])
#### Gov. Wolf‚Äôs ‚ÄúStrong Recommendation‚Äù Doesn‚Äôt Cut It with PA Republicans ‚ùå
Governor Wolf ‚Äústrongly recommended‚Äù that the PIAA cancel school sports this fall. This recommendation was supposedly based off the idea of social distancing, even though Gov. Wolf failed to provide any data to back up this recommendation. The PIAA decided as of Friday to continue on with fall sports, despite Gov. Wolf‚Äôs recommendation -- as they should.
The PIAA was unsure if they would face any legal ramifications if they ignored Gov. Wolf‚Äôs cavalier ‚Äúrecommendation,‚Äù so Pennsylvania House Republicans decided to look into it.
Rep. Seth Grove (R-Dover) filed a Right to Know Law request with the Pennsylvania Department of Health (DOH) to see what legal bearing Gov. Wolf‚Äôs ‚Äústrong recommendation‚Äù actually has. The DOH responded to this request confirming just what PA House Republicans suspected -- Gov. Wolf has no supporting data to justify his recommendation.
‚Üí Read more: PIAA votes to begin fall sports season on Monday (KDKA)

subject: Pelosi‚Äôs full-blown hypocrisy ü§¶
body_text:
###
###
###
* * *
September 2, 2020
* * *
Friend,
Did you see the footage that came out of Nancy Pelosi leaving a salon after getting her hair done, despite the salon being shut down due to city orders?
And she isn‚Äôt even wearing a mask!
The salon owner criticized Pelosi -- and rightfully so. She described Pelosi‚Äôs privilege as a ‚Äòslap in the face,‚Äô as the owner has been out of work for months while still trying to support her two young children without pay.
The owner told Fox News that government regulations have had her salon forced closed for months and she has been doing everything she can just to stay afloat.
This is a new low for the hypocrisy of Democrats. Of course, we should come to expect this by now. But Nancy Pelosi has been in office for decades and when questioned about this obviously hypocritical instance, she claimed she didn‚Äôt know she did anything wrong.
STOP PELOSI‚ÄôS PRIVILEGE
This is how Nancy Pelosi and her puppets in Congress work. Rules don‚Äôt apply to them. They preach for a socialist nation. They only want this because they know they can rise above it. As George Orwell wrote in Animal Farm, all animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
We, the people of Pennsylvania, must hold Nancy Pelosi accountable by diminishing her squad. We need true conservative candidates like Sean Parnell, Lisa Scheller and Luke Negron in office.
STOP THE HYPOCRISY OF THE LEFT
We cannot let this hypocrisy continue.
It starts with sending Nancy Pelosi a message from the great state of Pennsylvania. Are you with me?
YES! Hold Pelosi and her puppets accountable.
Sincerely,
Vonne Andring
Executive Director
Pennsylvania Republican Party

subject: Unbelievable.
body_text:
###
###
###
* * *
August 26, 2020
* * *
Friend,
I am saddened to even have to report this to you.
Speaker Nancy Pelosi went on MSNBC Monday stating that the Trump administration, and those who support it, are domestic enemies.
Trump supporters are domestic enemies, according to Nancy Pelosi.
Steve Scalise @SteveScalise üö® Disgusting: Nancy Pelosi just called Republicans "domestic enemies.‚Äù I was shot because of this kind of unhinged rhetoric. Where‚Äôs the media outrage?
So you and I are domestic enemies, according to Nancy Pelosi. We are domestic enemies because we stick up for our individual liberties and constitutional rights.
This is the kind of intolerant behavior that breeds the cancel culture ruining our society and destroying our way of life.
We must stand up to the left before they gain any more power or control. The alternative is frightening.
Please help us today to support difference of opinion, open conversation and a free society.
Right, Left, Red, Blue. We all have the right to voice our opinions and live by the morals we see as right and true.
Join us today to stand up to this gross intolerance.
Pro-life, pro-Trump and pro-democracy are not criminal opinions and this is not a censored socialist country -- yet.
Donate today to ensure it stays that way.
Sincerely,
Vonne Andring
Executive Director
Pennsylvania Republican Party

October 15, 2020

Dear Friend,
Big Tech is at it again.
This time, they weren‚Äôt so sneaky about their blinding bias toward censoring conservative voices online.
Twitter and Facebook censor New York Post: Smoking-gun email reveals how Hunter Biden introduced Ukrainian businessman to VP dad
DONATE NOW TO STOP CENSORSHIP OF CONSERVATIVES
In case you missed it, the New York Post released a story that broke down potentially incriminating emails between Hunter Biden and his corrupt Ukrainian conspirators.
I could go on about the deep-rooted issues with the story itself and the fact that Russian oligarchs certainly didn‚Äôt pay Hunter Biden for his ‚Äúconsulting services.‚Äù
Let‚Äôs make one thing clear: Corrupt Ukrainian ‚Äúbusinessmen‚Äù paid Hunter Biden millions of dollars because they wanted to pull his father, then-Vice President Joe Biden‚Äôs strings.
Also, let‚Äôs not forget when Joe Biden bragged about threatening to withhold U.S. aid from Ukraine if they didn‚Äôt fire the prosecutor who was investigating his son.
Friend, this is the exact definition of bribery -- not to mention the fact that it is on the dime of the U.S. taxpayer.
Yet, of course, you don‚Äôt see mainstream media covering this.
In fact, this development‚Äôs shock factor isn‚Äôt about Hunter Biden‚Äôs expos√© or that Joe Biden threatened Ukraine with U.S. taxpayer-funded dollars.
No, the real shock is the deliberate manipulation by Big Tech. Twitter and Facebook censored high-profile users who shared the breaking story released by the New York Post.
That‚Äôs right. Big Tech didn‚Äôt even bother to fact check the story before taking down posts related to the Hunter Biden scoop.
This blatant censorship and bias by social media companies like Facebook and Twitter must stop. I am sick of Big Tech constantly repressing conservative voices online.
If you are like me and cannot believe the blatant censorship of conservatives by Big Tech, please show your commitment to keeping Pennsylvania RED this November and chip in whatever you can right now.
Big Tech silencing our voices will only get worse.
Thank you for your constant support.
Best,
Vonne Andring

* * *
Chairman's Update
July 24, 2020
This is a new weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good morning, Pennsylvania.
I spoke with the Pennsylvania Senate Thursday about the ethical concerns of mail-in drop boxes. These boxes are not a valid means of submitting voter ballots. Mail-in drop boxes in fact threaten our constitutional rights and raise serious security concerns.
‚Üí Watch here: State Senate Governmental Committee discusses 2020 election issues (PAGOP)
Our current legislation simply does not permit drop boxes as a valid channel to submit a ballot. Rightfully so, since these drop boxes have no security to keep someone from tampering with ballots. 2020 is an essential election year. The voices of all Pennsylvanians must be heard. Join me in ensuring a credible election.
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Heidelbaugh puts the pressure on DA Krasner and AG Shapiro üî•
Philadelphia District Attorney Larry Krasner has a history of being weak on crime and Attorney General Josh Shapiro lets him get away with it. Crime is up nearly 70% in Philadelphia. Why? Well it could be due to the fact that these criminals know they won‚Äôt be prosecuted, so why not continue to get away with more crimes? DA Krasner doesn‚Äôt prosecute illegal gun crimes.
Heather Heidelbaugh, Republican candidate for Pennsylvania attorney general, is calling on AG Shapiro to hold Larry Krasner accountable. It is a sad day when criminals who rob, harm or threaten others with illegally obtained weapons are able to walk off free of charge. Our Commonwealth deserves better.
‚Üí Watch this: Josh Shapiro stays silent as Larry Krasner refuses to prosecute gun possession charges (YouTube)
#### Governor Wolf strikes out ‚ùå
Sen. Toomey has been vocal about working with the MLB and health officials to safely bring back baseball to Pittsburgh. There was support among all parties involved to bring the Toronto Blue Jays to play at PNC Park. The world was waiting on the green light from Governor Wolf.
Of course where there is common sense discussion between the public and private sector, Democrats are bound to come in and slow down progress. Gov. Wolf and Dr. Levine announced Wednesday the Blue Jays would not be permitted to play at PNC Park. Sen. Toomey ‚Äî who held a roundtable discussion with MLB and health officials earlier this week ‚Äî expressed disapproval of the decision made by Gov. Wolf. Sen. Toomey pointed out that Gov. Wolf deprived Pittsburgh of a great economic opportunity with his decision.
‚Üí Read more: Pa. won‚Äôt allow Blue Jays to play at Pittsburgh‚Äôs PNC Park (AP)
#### PA House power checks Gov. Wolf ‚öñÔ∏è
The Pennsylvania House voted July 14 to restore power to the people, rather than Gov. Wolf. Senate Bill 1166 prohibits Gov. Wolf‚Äôs emergency declaration from lasting longer than 21 days. Once the 21 days are up, the PA General Assembly can vote on whether the emergency declaration should continue or not.
Currently, Gov. Wolf‚Äôs emergency declarations can last up to 90 days. For three whole months, Gov. Wolf is able to have a hold over our Commonwealth.
‚ÄúWe believe the power of our Commonwealth truly rests with the people. Pennsylvania is not a dictatorship, and the voters should ultimately decide. We are a co-equal branch of government and have tried at every turn to work with the administration, including asking to join a multi-branch, bipartisan task force to manage this crisis. The governor turned us down, deciding instead to go it alone for months on end.‚Äù ‚Äî Speaker of the House Bryan Cutler
‚Üí Read more: House acts to give Pennsylvania voice in emergencies (PA House)

body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
June 18, 2020
This is a new weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good evening, Pennsylvania.
I hope everyone is remaining happy and healthy during this unique time.
Our Republican leadership had a busy week, so I will keep this introduction short.
We are less than four months away from Election Day and things are heating up in Pennsylvania. Our Republican primary winners are officially geared up to take on their Democratic opponents.
Everyday we are motivated more and more by the left of just how important it is to win this November. I cannot thank you enough for your support.
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
DONATE NOW
#### Bye-bye, Governor Wolf üëã
It is no secret Governor Wolf is not the best at his job‚Ä¶to say the least.
Republican lawmakers are fed up with his lack of leadership and complete mishandling of the coronavirus pandemic. This is why they called for his impeachment.
House Resolution 915, introduced by Rep. Daryl Metcalfe, calls for Gov. Wolf to step down amid his disastrous mishandling and abuse of executive order surrounding the coronavirus.
In last week‚Äôs newsletter, we mentioned how the General Assembly and Republican leadership issued a joint statement raising concerns over Gov. Wolf‚Äôs executive order. Gov. Wolf refused to lift this emergency declaration, even while he stood shoulder to shoulder with protestors holding ‚ÄúBLUE LIVES MURDER‚Äù signs. At this point, ‚Äúnonessential businesses‚Äù were still forced closed under Gov. Wolf‚Äôs executive order.
Gov. Wolf‚Äôs team has stated this impeachment resolution is unwarranted and that the Governor‚Äôs handling of the coronavirus was successful. We clearly must have different definitions of success.
‚Üí Read more: Pennsylvania lawmakers introduce resolution calling for impeachment of Gov. Tom Wolf (Morning Call)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### U.S. Senator Toomey stands up for our health care workers
On June 11th, Senator Toomey announced that eight Pennsylvania health care providers received a total of $1,275,738 from the Federal Communications Commission's (FCC) COVID-19 Telehealth Program, which was established by the CARES Act.
The Provider Relief Fund was first authorized at $100 billion by the CARES Act to support COVID-19 expenses and lost revenue for hospitals and health care providers. In the recently passed "phase 3.5" coronavirus relief bill, Congress authorized an additional $75 billion, bringing the fund's total to $175 billion. To date, more than $39 billion has been disbursed from the Provider Relief Fund to providers and hospitals across the country. Thanks to Sen. Toomey, Pennsylvania hospitals and health care providers have received an additional $458,646,110 of the second $20 billion disbursement of the Provider Relief Fund.
‚Üí Learn more: COVID-19 telehealth program (Federal Communications Commission)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Senate leaders battled with Governor Wolf against emergency declaration
Senate President Pro Tempore Joe Scarnati and Senate Majority Leader Jake Corman were applauded by the Commonwealth Court‚Äôs decision to expedite consideration of the emergency case filed to force Gov. Wolf to comply with House Resolution 836, which was passed by the General Assembly with bipartisan support. The court issued an order this morning mandating a response from the administration on this matter by June 18.
In the court filing from earlier this week, the leaders explained that despite a majority of the Senate and the House of Representatives adopting HR 836, Gov. Wolf has refused to perform the mandatory and ministerial duty of issuing an executive order or proclamation ending the state of disaster emergency originally declared March 6, 2020 and amended and renewed on June 3, 2020.
‚ÄúWe are pleased that the Court has recognized the urgency of this matter and will be expediting review of the case. Protecting civil liberties is a crucial issue that impacts the lives of every Pennsylvanian. Our Constitution established three equal branches of government to provide checks and balance.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Senator Scarnati progress on healthcare issues (Senator Joe Scarnati)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
# Speaker Turzai isn't done yet
Speaker Mike Turzai‚Äôs reform bill that addresses criminal justice reform and policing within our communities was unanimously passed by the Judiciary Committee. House Bill 1841, House Bill 1910 and Senate Bill 637 are reforms to help our police better perform their very challenging and difficult responsibilities. We are working toward the passage of legislation that improves our law enforcement policing to instill an environment of healing, understanding and trust.
Speaker Turzai said that while his position has ended, there is still a job to do.
‚ÄúI believe this will strengthen our confidence that this body will continue its promise of a better Pennsylvania for all citizens. I am sure the House will continue efforts to promote education choice, economic opportunity for all, and additional criminal justice reforms.
‚ÄúThe lives of every citizen matter, including the lives of those citizens of color. These reforms are important to all citizens, but especially to our citizens of black or brown color who feel threatened by a system that can disregard their humanity.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Speaker Turzai reform bills unanimously passes (Pennsylvania House Republican Caucus)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward

September 25, 2020

Good morning, Pennsylvania.
Pennsylvania had a busy week as Republican leaders, including President Trump, visited to get out the vote! I had the privilege to do my part by speaking at PACPAC over the weekend. Pennsylvania is the state that can win the presidency! It was awesome seeing a crowd that is excited to get to the polls and vote RED up and down the ballot. The enthusiasm is unprecedented for the Republican Party, which is mirrored in voter registration.
We worked strategically after 2016 to target voters to switch over to the Republican Party. There have been 52,440 more newly registered Republicans than Democrats this year! Regardless of what Democrats tell you, the Republican Party is appealing to Pennsylvanians across the Commonwealth!
Chairman Lawrence Tabas addressing PACPAC.
‚Üí Read More: Check out these voter registration numbers! (Citizens Voice)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Another veto by King Wolf üõë
It seems like Governor Wolf does not want anyone but himself to decide what is best for Pennsylvanians. Gov. Wolf vetoed a bipartisan bill that would have given local officials authority this year to decide whether to hold K-12 sports and activities or not, and set crowd limits at events. Apparently Gov. Wolf and his sidekicks are the experts, and the little guys must trust the so-called "experts." He notes the bill threatened his executive power, thus exposing the real reason for the veto.
GOP lawmakers will attempt to override Gov. Wolf‚Äôs veto. Rep. Mike Reese blasted Gov. Wolf by defending local officials saying they ‚Äúknow their facilities and have no less commitment to public safety than Governor Wolf.‚Äù Leader Kerry Benninghoff also called out Gov. Wolf, ‚ÄúIn vetoing this bill, Governor Wolf stands directly opposed to children and families looking for some semblance of normalcy and to receive the numerous invaluable benefits of fully participating in school sports‚Ä¶‚Äù The fight is not over as Republicans attempt to find Democratic allies to override Wolf‚Äôs veto.
We must remember the actions of this governor this November and vote red up and down the ticket!
‚Üí Read more: Governor Wolf continues to dictate to the public (PennLive)
‚Üí Read more: Judge Stickman finds little evidence to justify Wolf‚Äôs actions (Courier Times)
#### PA Republican candidates against socialism ‚ùå
CPAC has hit the road making stops at key swing states, including Pennsylvania. PA conservative candidates and representatives spoke on a variety of topics. The theme of day was America against socialism and our Republican candidates vehemently spoke against socialism!
Republican candidate Heather Heidelbaugh reminded voters about the importance of her race against Gov. Wolf‚Äôs partner in crime, Attorney General Josh Shapiro. Shapiro has defended Wolf's closure of PA in the court since day one. Meanwhile, Democrat Congressman Conor Lamb continues to vote with Nancy Pelosi and her squad. Sean Parnell, Republican congressional candidate for PA-17, vows to keep his word and defend your constitutional rights.
Let‚Äôs defend American and Pennsylvania values by ensuring our great Commonwealth goes red!
Heather Heidelbaugh, Republican candidate for PA attorney general, addresses crowd at PACPAC
‚Üí Read more: Conservatives warn voters what at stake this November (TribLive)
‚Üí Read more: Heather Heidelbaugh sides with Judge Stickman on ruling (New Castle News)
#### Trump comes to Pittsburgh üö®
There weren‚Äôt many Terrible Towels flying around but there sure were a lot of MAGA hats! President Trump spoke to an energetic, large crowd on Tuesday night. He highlighted the exponential job creation under his administration, vowing to keep fracking and other energy jobs -- unlike Joe. President Trump said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll keep your jobs in Pennsylvania where they belong, and you‚Äôre going to be doing fracking for a long time.‚Äù He assured Pennsylvanians he will continue to bring back jobs from China. The crowd cheered, ‚ÄúWe love you!‚Äù Pittsburgh truly brought the love on Tuesday, and will continue all the way to Nov. 3!
Let me tell you another tidbit from Tuesday‚Äôs rally -- and this is the difference between the right and the left. Since Pittsburgh Police officers have received zero support from ultra-leftist Mayor Bill Peduto, a nonprofit organization composed of police officers from twenty-two surrounding municipalities stepped in to offer security at President Trump‚Äôs rally. These police officers were met with cheering and applause as they made their way to the tarmac to await President Trump. This is the thanks our men and women in blue deserve.
‚Üí Watch here: President Trump excites the Pittsburgh crowd! (WTAE)

Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
November 3rd is coming up quickly and I‚Äôm breaking down what you need to know about the election process in Pennsylvania. During my interview with Commonwealth Partners President and CEO Matt Brouillette, I talk about the good and bad of mail-in ballots. We discussed everything from mail-in ballots to Republican enthusiasm in Pennsylvania on the Commonwealth Partners Chamber of Entrepreneurs‚Äô ‚ÄúBrews & Views‚Äù podcast.
Mail-in ballots pose a lot of challenges to the election process. Democrats want more than 50 days to mail in ballots -- which makes it seem like they have a political agenda. I also discuss how clear it is that Democratic policies are failing working class communities, which is why they‚Äôre becoming Republicans! All across Pennsylvania we see huge support from the working class for President Trump. The Republican Party is the party for the working class!
‚Üí Listen Here: Check out my interview on mail-in ballots (SoundCloud)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Governor Wolf got served üë®‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è
U.S. District Judge William S. Stickman IV struck down Governor Wolf‚Äôs coronavirus restrictions citing violations of the First and Fourteenth Amendment. Judge Stickman stated, ‚ÄúThe solution to a national crisis can never be permitted to supersede the commitment to individual liberty that stands as the foundation of the American experiment.‚Äù
This ruling is a WIN for business owners who have been crushed by Gov. Wolf‚Äôs extreme restrictions. Plaintiffs included hairdressers, farmers, Republican officials, along with other small business owners. However, the fight is not over because Gov. Wolf's administration immediately announced he will appeal the federal judge‚Äôs ruling.
‚Üí Read more: Pennsylvania coronavirus restrictions deemed unconstitutional, federal judge rules (Fox News)
‚Üí Read more: Pennsylvania Gov. Tom Wolf appealing federal judge ruling that called pandemic shutdown order unconstitutional (CBSN)
#### More riots = more silence ü§ê
Rioters take the streets in Lancaster causing violence and destruction to the community. After a police officer shot and killed a man charging at him while wielding a knife, Democrats condemned the officer. Senator Pat Toomey defends the police officer stating:
"A full-grown man, wielding a large carving knife over his head while charging an officer, obviously poses a mortal threat to that officer. In general, police officers in this type of situation are well within their rights to use deadly force to protect themselves and the public‚Ä¶‚Äù
We cannot let rioters destroy our communities any longer. We must stand with the law enforcement community and offer our full support. To condemn an officer who is defending their life, along with the wellbeing of the Commonwealth, is plain ignorant. I would bet the majority of these Democratic leaders have no idea what it is like to go into work every day and put your life on the line.
As the riots continue, failed Democratic leadership is exposed. Republican candidate for Attorney General tweeted:
It‚Äôs clear Pennsylvania needs leadership that helps our law enforcement promote law and order in our streets.
‚Üí Read more: Lancaster protesters held on whopping $1 million bail each after alleged riots (Fox News)
‚Üí Read more: Riots erupt in Lancaster after police shoot charging assailant (The Federalist)
#### Will Levine finally be held accountable? ü§î
The Department of Justice sent letters to Pennsylvania and three other states seeking data on whether they violated federal law by ordering public nursing homes to accept recovering COVID-19 patients from hospitals. Near the end of March, the governor issued an executive order that required nursing and personal care homes to accept coronavirus patients.
Under Health Secretary Rachel Levine‚Äôs guidance, nursing homes were even advised that there was no particular benefit in separating or isolating coronavirus patients from others. It took an entire month before they rescinded this advice. Close to 67% of Pennsylvania‚Äôs coronavirus deaths occurred in nursing homes, which didn‚Äôt stop Gov. Wolf shutting down the entire state. Now, hopefully some justice and transparency will finally be brought about.
‚Üí Read more: DOJ seeks data about COVID nursing home deaths from Pa., 3 other states (Penn Live)
‚Üí Read more: Rep. Guy Reschenthaler: Pennsylvania deserves better (TribLive)

Good morning, Pennsylvania.
We now know Joe Biden‚Äôs VP pick; far-left, liberal Kamala Harris. A Biden-Harris ticket is bad for Pennsylvania. Harris was by far the most liberal contender for VP. Lawrence J. Tabas

#### "There‚Äôs No Question, I‚Äôm in Favor of Banning Fracking.‚Äù
These were words uttered by the Democratic vice presidential nominee. Banning fracking in PA could lead to more than 600,000 job losses. Harris has a record of suing oil companies for environmental violations and backing the Green New Deal. Biden choosing Harris pushes his environmental policies even further to the left.
Kathleen Sgamma, head of the Western Energy Alliance stated, ‚ÄúWhile most of that work is rhetoric, her accusations against an industry that provides 70% of the energy Americans use every day belies the narrative that Biden/Harris would govern in a moderate way.‚Äù Fracking has rescued communities in our Commonwealth from devastation. Banning fracking in PA would be catastrophic for our communities -- to say the least.
‚Üí Read more: Kamala Harris environmental policies will hurt PA‚Äôs economy (NewsMax)
#### Governor Wolf‚Äôs War on Sport üö´
Governor Wolf released his guidelines for schools going back to school this fall. The punchline? Fall sports are canceled. PIAA is pushing back: Executive Director Bob Lombardi stated, ‚ÄúWe would like to have full support. However, it was a recommendation. It wasn‚Äôt a mandate and it wasn‚Äôt an order. If it was an order, we probably wouldn‚Äôt be having the discussion we‚Äôre having here.‚Äù
PA Republicans want to provide parents with an option to allow kids to repeat the school year, thus balancing the pressure of academic achievement with the outlet of physical activity.
Rep. Jesse Topper notes this bill gives parents the freedom to choose -- not the schools. There is no underestimating the importance of teenagers having an outlet, especially in these challenging times.
‚Üí Read more: PA GOP bill to combat cancelling fall sports (Times Leader)
#### Sen. Toomey Must be Doing Something Right üá®üá≥
Senator Toomey and Chris Van Hollen‚Äôs bill, Hong Kong Autonomy Act, was signed into law that led to Communist China sanctioning certain senators. The bill targets China‚Äôs aggressive crack down on the people of Hong Kong‚Äôs freedoms. Sen. Toomey‚Äôs response to this sanction was simple: ‚ÄúI stand with the people of Hong Kong.‚Äù
Sen. Toomey defends the people of Hong Kong who represent democracy and freedom. He will continue holding China accountable for their human rights violations and is not scared to face the growing threat of the Chinese Communist Party fearlessly.
‚Üí Read more: Toomey‚Äôs response to the sanctions (Toomey)
#### Gov. Wolf Ignores PA Legislature, Again ü§¶
Senate Majority Leader Jake Corman called out Gov. Wolf‚Äôs war on sports. Sen. Corman said nearly all of his Republican peers in the Pennsylvania Senate support schools having fall sports. Sen. Corman pointed out two key problems with Gov. Wolf‚Äôs decision:
1. Gov. Wolf did not consult the Pennsylvania Legislature on this decision before going public.
2. Gov. Wolf did not declare an executive order, just a ‚Äòstrong recommendation.‚Äô
Now the PIAA is in a tough position. As Sen. Corman told Erie News Now, "He (Gov. Wolf) put the PIAA in a really difficult position. He should have made it an order if he could, or he should have stayed out of it." The consequences of violating Gov. Wolf‚Äôs recommendation is still unclear.
‚Üí Read more: Panel delays decision on Pennsylvania sports for two weeks (Erie News Now)

Heather Heidelbaugh‚Äôs new television ad shares her inspiring story of overcoming adversity and becoming a successful trial lawyer. Shapiro is rumored to have his sights on the governor's mansion in 2022 and Heidelbaugh promises to serve a full term as PA's attorney general.

subject: GOP Goes Three for Three in Special Elections
body_text:
Dear Friend--
Did you see the headlines?!! Republicans swept three special elections for the Pennsylvania House!
The March 17 Special Elections weren‚Äôt victories won by the luck of the Irish. They were won by great candidates with strong messages and great turnout. We had a lot working against us: Democrats out spending us, a last minute lawsuit to delay the election, and the COVID-19 virus.
Politics PA wrote:
‚ÄúAlthough each district was previously represented by a Republican prior to the vacancy, not all of the races were viewed as clear Republican holds.‚Äù
The Pennsylvania Capital-Star observed:
‚ÄúThe wins came across the commonwealth, from suburban Philadelphia to old milltowns south of Pittsburgh to a rural district in western Pennsylvania, and left the GOP confident for the rest of 2020 ‚Äî including up to November‚Äôs critical presidential [[URL REDACTED]] looked in play for Democrats, but the party did not draw out enough former Blue Dogs in southwestern Pennsylvania or Trump-skeptical suburbanites outside Philadelphia to flip a district.‚Äù
The Bucks County Courier-Times noted an important fact as well:
‚ÄúThe Republican Party noted the Democrats spent more than $900,000 but lost the three races in the special election.‚Äù
PA Post added:
‚ÄúTuesday‚Äôs turnout met or slightly exceeded election directors‚Äô expectations of between 10 and 15 percent (turnout is typically quite low for special elections).
Turnout in the 8th District was in that range in its Butler County section (11 percent) and higher in the Mercer County part (17 percent). In Westmoreland County, the 58th saw a 20 percent turnout, up from 17 percent for its last special four years ago for the adjacent state House district.
Turnout was 20 percent in 18th District, which lies entirely in Bensalem Township (Bucks County), versus 12 percent at the county‚Äôs last special in 2009, according to elections director Thomas Freitag.‚Äù
Even RNC Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel celebrated our victories:
Our message is reaching across party lines and pulling in unlikely voters, but we‚Äôre not sitting back! The April 28th Primary Election will be here quick, and we want to encourage you, your friends and your neighbors to register Republican! Click here to learn more on how you can register online, and here to apply for a new Mail-in ballot.
Working together we‚Äôll re-elect President Trump, win the statewide row offices, turn Congress Red, and expand our state legislative majorities.
Onward to Victory!
Chairman Lawrence Tabas

subject: Chairman's Update: June 25th
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
June 25, 2020
This is a new weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
Today I wanted to take a moment to congratulate Representative Bryan Cutler to his new role as Speaker of the House. Rep. Cutler was unanimously elected into his position as Speaker by his peers in the Pennsylvania House. At the Pennsylvania Republican Party, we are excited to continue our relationship with Rep. Cutler and continue to see results brought to the Commonwealth.
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
DONATE NOW
#### The show must go on‚Ä¶ but only for Governor Wolf
Governor Wolf‚Äôs coronavirus hypocrisy is nationally known at this point, and it doesn‚Äôt seem to be getting any better.
State Health Secretary Rachel Levine sued Carlisle Events for having too many individuals registered to attend their annual car show. Sec. Levine cited the Carlisle show was violating the 250-person cap on gatherings within the state. Interesting, because I don‚Äôt recall Sec. Levine reminding Gov. Wolf of this ‚Äú250-person cap‚Äù when he decided to parade the streets of Harrisburg shoulder to shoulder with protestors.
Sec. Levine threatened if Carlisle Events didn‚Äôt comply, they would be met with ‚Äúcriminal and civil penalties.‚Äù Again, interesting how Sec. Levine is quick to call on the support of law enforcement, while the trusty Gov. Wolf was photographed two weeks earlier with signs that read ‚ÄúBLUE LIVES MURDER.‚Äù
So which is it? Will the left come crawling to law enforcement when it‚Äôs convenient to them? Or will they protest in the streets and call police officers murderers?
‚Üí Read more: Pennsylvania sues to stop car show over crowd size even after Gov. Wolf marched in protest two weeks earlier (Fox News)
‚Üí Watch this: The streets of Philadelphia are PACKED with protestors, despite Sec. Levine‚Äôs ‚Äú250-person cap‚Äù on events (Twitter)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Toomey calls out Senate Democrats
Senate Democrats blocked Senator Tim Scott‚Äôs (R-SC) Justice Act Wednesday from even being considered in the Senate. U.S. Senator Pat Toomey called out Senate Democrats for choosing politics over progress, since they are not even letting a legislative discussion begin on the Justice Act.
Senate Democrats have spent the past couple weeks demanding policing reforms. Now that a bill was introduced, they chose to obstruct it rather than have actual bipartisan discussions to amend it. It is clear they only want to complain instead of work out actual results between both parties.
‚Üí Read more: Sen. Toomey expresses disappointment in Senate Democrats blocking legislative discussion of Justice Act (Twitter)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Welcome, Speaker Cutler!
Rep. Bryan Cutler (R-Peach Bottom) previously served as majority leader before being unanimously voted in to serve as Speaker of the House of Representatives. Speaker Cutler is the third person ever from Lancaster County to serve as Speaker of the House. He has served in the Pennsylvania Legislature for 13 years and his leadership has been instrumental in the successes of the 2020 Pennsylvania legislative session.
Speaker Cutler released the following statement regarding new leadership in the Pennsylvania Legislature:
‚ÄúThis group spanning varied backgrounds, experiences and regions of our Commonwealth reflect what Pennsylvanians have been asking for.
‚ÄúThe challenges and pathways to success are evolving, and our energized and effective leaders humbly accept the responsibilities entrusted to us by our districts and also now by our fellow caucus members.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Cutler elected Speaker of the House (Pennsylvania House Republican Caucus)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Hats off, Majority Leader Benninghoff üé©
With Rep. Cutler being elected to serve as Speaker of the House, a vote was cast to promote Rep. Kerry Benninghoff (R-Centre/Mifflin) to majority floor leader. Rep. Benninghoff previously served as the majority whip and has held multiple leadership positions within the state House.
Rep. Benninghoff stated:
‚ÄúI am humbled and grateful for the opportunity to lead, but most importantly, the opportunity to serve.
‚ÄúPennsylvania, like much of the nation, is at a critical crossroads. The good news is, we can see the challenges we face as opportunities to catapult change. If we work together, I believe we can usher in a bright and exciting future for our Commonwealth.‚Äù
‚Üí Watch this: Rep. Benninghoff reacts to being elected as majority leader (Facebook)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Also this week:
‚Üí Watch this: Senator Scarnati encourages Pennsylvanians to support small businesses (Facebook)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Go long! In the age of social media, it‚Äôs rewarding to see kids still finding time to play outside. üèà (Twitter)

September 26, 2020
* * *
Friend,
I will keep this short since it is a Saturday night.
It is official: President Trump has nominated Judge Amy Coney Barrett for the Supreme Court vacancy.
Amy Coney Barrett is an experienced constitutional conservative and would be an undeniable asset to the Supreme Court bench.
Now, President Trump‚Äôs nomination is in the hands of the Senate. Please join me in telling the Senate: CONFIRM JUDGE CONEY BARRETT!
We are asking you to pledge $51 for 51 votes in the Senate.
$51 FOR 51 VOTES
The Democrats are using President Trump‚Äôs nomination as an excuse to expand the Supreme Court bench and even push it to function more as a legislative branch.
Newsflash: This doesn‚Äôt fly in America.
Amy Coney Barrett is a proven constitutionalist. We need her on the Supreme Court to not only preserve the Constitution, but also for the sake of our nation.
‚òëÔ∏è  CONFIRM JUDGE CONEY BARRETT ‚òëÔ∏è
We are nearing Nov. 3. Cases may arise that jeopardize the integrity of our election. If this was to ever happen, we cannot risk having a Court divided to 4-4. Riots and violence would only get worse.
We cannot afford any more turmoil and unrest in our nation.
This is why I am calling on you to join me and tell the Senate CONFIRM JUDGE CONEY BARRETT!
We need your support to elect like-minded conservatives to office. If more Democrats are elected in Pennsylvania, there is no telling what will be done to alter the Supreme Court.
Thank you for your support.
Lawrence Tabas

subject: Chairman's Update: July 2nd
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
July 2, 2020
This is a new weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
It has been a busy week here in our great Commonwealth. The Trump campaign is suing Pennsylvania statewide election officials for the unconstitutional ballot boxes that were used during the PA Primary. The Pennsylvania Supreme Court nullified the Pennsylvania Legislature‚Äôs House Resolution 836, and by doing so sided with Governor Wolf and his abuse of power.
There is a bright side, however.
The Republican leadership in the PA Legislature is continuing to do great things and produce real, commonsense solutions. Their bipartisan efforts should serve as a model for Congress.
Lastly, I want to wish you a blessed and safe 4th of July weekend. We are truly blessed to live in this great nation. Happy 4th!
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
DONATE NOW
#### I had a (virtual) sitdown with Sean Spicer
The Trump campaign has called to ban all mail-in ballot boxes that aren‚Äôt located at official county board of election sites for the general election. It shouldn‚Äôt be so complicated to make sure ballots are counted at official county board of election (BOE) sites, and not just a strategically placed box by the partisan proxies of the BOE.
I spoke to former White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer on this issue. Here‚Äôs the thing : These ballot drop boxes are unconstitutional, end of story.
It is not a lot to ask for the vote of every Pennsylvanian to be fairly counted. These ballot boxes have:
* No staff to make sure ballots aren‚Äôt tampered with.
* No cameras to monitor safety of each ballot.
* County BOE players that pick and choose ballot box locations.
These ballot boxes put the voice and vote of every Pennsylvanian at risk for the 2020 election.
‚Üí Watch this: PAGOP Chairman Lawrence Tabas discusses ballot boxes with Sean Spicer (PAGOP News)
‚Üí Read more: Trump campaign sues Pennsylvania over mail-in ballot drop boxes (Newsmax)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Toomey takes on Chinese Communist Party‚Ä¶ Again
U.S. Senator Pat Toomey‚Äôs bipartisan Hong Kong Autonomy Act passed unanimously in the Senate last week. This is a great step toward holding China accountable, and we are grateful for Sen. Toomey‚Äôs work with Sen. Van Hollen to ensure the inclusion of this act as an amendment to the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA).
The United States must stand for Hong Kong as it fights for freedom. Sen. Toomey and Sen. Van Hollen‚Äôs bill would impose sanctions on the Chinese Communist Party and support Hongkongers seeking to enter the United States.
This is a huge victory against China. "Last week, the Senate stood up to the communist regime in Beijing and stood with the people of Hong Kong," said Senator Toomey.
‚Üí Read more: Hong Kong Autonomy Act (U.S. Senate)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
#### Speaker Cutler on Face the State üëÄ
Speaker Cutler sat down with Ryan Eldredge on Rob Hanrahan‚Äôs ‚ÄúFace the State‚Äù to discuss his new role as House Speaker.
Speaker Cutler discussed that while the coronavirus pandemic has temporarily halted meetings with legislative members across the state, he looks forward to continuing this tradition when the time is right. Speaker Cutler regularly visited members of the state legislature as majority leader and House whip, and looks forward to doing the same in his new role.
Speaker Cutler also touched on the Pennsylvania Legislature‚Äôs current bipartisan efforts to have actual, effective conversations on police reform.
‚ÄúThe biggest part is we were able to sit down and talk through the bills and their different components,‚Äù Speaker Cutler said when asked how members are able to work together to find a solution.
It seems Congress could learn a thing or two from our statewide legislators here in Pennsylvania.
‚Üí Watch this: Face the State | House Speaker Bryan Cutler & Rep. Chris Rabb (Local 21 News)
Share Share
Tweet Tweet
Forward Forward
# PA Supreme Court sides with Gov. Wolf, Senate leaders show disapproval
Senate President Scarnati issued a joint statement along with Senate Majority Leader Corman on Wednesday strongly criticizing the Pennsylvania Supreme Court for nullifying PA Legislature‚Äôs call to end Gov. Wolf‚Äôs executive order.
Gov. Wolf refused to end this order, demonstrating a complete abuse of power. This explains why House Resolution 838 passed in the PA General Assembly with bipartisan support.
Sen. Scarnati said the following on the matter:
‚ÄúToday‚Äôs ruling by the Supreme Court fails to uphold the Constitutional balance of power between the three, co-equal branches of government.
‚ÄúWe understand the need for a temporary suspension of civil liberties under dire circumstances ‚Äì something we agreed needed to happen initially as we worked to flatten the curve. However, while we work to protect lives, we cannot continue to disregard the civil liberties of Pennsylvanians. Our government was established to be of the people, by the people and for the people. With this ruling the Court has elected not to uphold the foundation of our democracy.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Senate Leaders issue statement on Supreme Court ruling against House Resolution 836 (PA Senate)

* * *
September 22, 2020
* * *
Friend,
The Democratic Party is trying to claim ownership of the Supreme Court and prevent President Trump from appointing a true conservative to the bench.
Governor Wolf ruled unconstitutional!
This is the difference between Democrats and Republicans. The Democratic Party always believes they are owed something.
This is not how the Supreme Court works. The Supreme Court doesn‚Äôt owe anyone anything. The Supreme Court is there to lawfully, and faithfully, uphold our Constitution.
PROTECT OUR CONSTITUTION üá∫üá∏
That is the beauty of the Supreme Court, it doesn‚Äôt belong to a political party.
I like to say nothing from the left surprises me anymore but this weekend hit a new low -- fundraising off of the passing of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.
The Democrats have raised $71 million since the death of Justice Ginsburg. The left thinks they can buy this Court seat. I have a message for the left: The Supreme Court belongs to the people, NOT a political party.
It is well within President Donald Trump‚Äôs duty to nominate a new Supreme Court justice. This is where our democracy comes to life. It will then be up to the Senate on whether or not the nomination is approved. President Trump‚Äôs nomination will need 51 votes to pass through the Senate.
We cannot leave anything for chance this Election Day. Our American principles are under fire and the Constitution must prevail.
Our constitutional rights are at risk, will you pledge $51 for 51 votes in the Senate?
We need your help to ensure our democracy remains intact.
We need your help to protect our constitutional rights.
We need your help to stop the Democratic Party from expecting to be owed whatever they want.
Thank you for your support.
Sincerely,
Vonne Andring

body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
August 28, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good morning, Pennsylvania.
What an honor it was to officially renominate Donald J. Trump for President of the United States of America. The Republican National Convention highlighted the importance of this election. With a myriad of wonderful and inspiring speakers, the RNC depicted how great America truly is.
The battle ahead of us will not be easy but the RNC showed our party‚Äôs strength and vigor to fight for American values and freedom. President Trump reminded us just last week that ‚ÄúJoe Biden is no friend of Pennsylvania.‚Äù We agree! PA is ready to once again go red for President Trump!
‚Üí Read more: Delegates officially renominate Donald Trump (Fox News)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Gov. Wolf‚Äôs proposes pricey and unrealistic fall agenda üí∞üí∞
Governor Wolf unveiled his fall agenda this week. During a news conference, the governor took a jab at Republican lawmakers for checking his power during the pandemic. To clarify, Gov. Wolf was mad that our Republican leaders are actually doing their jobs and holding him accountable. Gov. Wolf‚Äôs proposals call for a hefty amount of money for various programs. This includes $250 million for childcare, $10 million for PPE, $100 million for low-income housing, and millions of dollars spent elsewhere. All of this sounds great but this is not a time for Pennsylvanians to pay even more in taxes to the government than we already do.
Gov. Wolf suggested lawmakers legalize the recreational use of marijuana to increase revenue. It is unlikely his pricey proposals will pass this fall as Republicans are focused on reopening Pennsylvania‚Äôs economy, not spending huge amounts of money.
Pennsylvania House Majority Leader Kerry Benninghoff responded to Gov. Wolf‚Äôs plans noting the unrealistic amount of spending. He said, ‚ÄúIt is disingenuous for this governor to put forward an unaffordable legislative agenda and require taxpayers to bail him out of his unilateral mandates that have devastated their lives and livelihoods.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Wolf expensive agenda (WGAL)
#### Sen. Toomey continues to fight the visible enemy, Covid-19 üëä
Senator Toomey spoke in York and Lebanon County with local employers about the impact of coronavirus on the economy. Sen. Toomey wants PA to reopen safely and he is there to help every step of the way. He assured the concerned employers Congress is working on another funding bill for relief. Toomey wants to protect employers against rash Covid-19 lawsuits. He is hopeful a bill will be passed by September.
Next stop, Sen. Toomey talks to employers in Lebanon, PA about their economic hardships during the pandemic. The senator noted the extensive locked place by Gov. Wolf as a reason for the slow economic recovery. Many restaurant and bar owners are still grappling with severe and unnecessary restrictions. The people in both counties expressed their frustrations about the slow opening of PA. Sen. Toomey and Representative Scott Perry shared those frustrations and assured them the federal government will continue to help.
‚Üí Read more: Senator Toomey criticizes Wolf‚Äôs restrictions (PennLive)
#### Sean Parnell ‚ÄúAmerica needs all her patriots to rush to her defense.‚Äù
Republican congressional candidate for Pennsylvania‚Äôs 17th district, Sean Parnell, spoke Monday night at the RNC. His speech focused on freedom and unity. Parnell highlighted his exceptional military experience fighting in Afghanistan. He notes the diversity within his platoon and banding together as brothers in the face of battle and death. These American heroes were united, not divided. Parnell wants the same for all Americans today.
Parnell also discussed President Trump‚Äôs work in his last four years, calling on all people regardless of party affiliation to vote for Trump. Parnell criticized the Democratic Party, ‚ÄúI don't see a party that wants you to be free. I see a party that wants to chain you to conformity and will destroy anyone they deem a heretic.‚Äù Parnell is running against up-and-coming liberal star, Conor Lamb, who also spoke at his party‚Äôs convention. Parnell vowed to protect the Constitution and serve the people in the 17th district of Pennsylvania.
‚Üí Watch here: Parnell‚Äôs full speech (WTAE)
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Watch this: President Trump‚Äôs pardon that brought people to tears! (The Hill)

From: Lawrence Tabas, PAGOP Chairman <[[URL REDACTED]]>

Subject: Have you seen our Team?
Dear Friend--
While Democrats in DC are busy with their sham impeachment, the Pennsylvania Republican party has just endorsed the most qualified statewide row office candidates in history. We‚Äôre energized and ready to go head to head against the liberal policies of the Democrats!
Meet our Team that will take back our row offices this November!
Attorney General - Heather Heidelbaugh: is an attorney with more than thirty five years experience in the courtroom. She‚Äôs tough, smart and she‚Äôll keep our families safe and protected. We need a full-time lawyer as attorney general, not a temp waiting for his turn to run for governor.
Auditor General - Tim DeFoor: has been nationally recognized for his efforts to save taxpayer dollars as Dauphin County Comptroller. Tim will work hard and keep an eye on Pennsylvania‚Äôs checkbook and work against the frivolous spending of the Wolf administration.
Stacy Garrity - Treasurer: served three combat tours in Iraq. She‚Äôs a retired Army Colonel who is accustomed to breaking glass ceilings. As Treasurer, Stacy will stop Governor Wolf‚Äôs blank check writing and return the staggering $3.5 billion dollars in unclaimed property taxes to the taxpayers.
Heather, Tim, and Stacy NEED your help TODAY! Can you support our 2020 Team with a donation of $20.20, double it for $40.40, $200.20 or even $2020.00?
Every dollar that is contributed will go directly into our grassroots efforts...hitting every door and every voter we can. Momentum is on our side, because of people like you. Click here to pitch in your support TODAY so we can get our great slate across the finish line.
With gratitude,
Chairman Lawrence Tabas
Republican Party of Pennsylvania
P.S.
Every dollar you contribute stays right here in Pennsylvania to support our 2020 Republican candidates up and down the ballot. Your gift of $20.20, $40.40, $200.20 or even $2,020 can make the difference this November! Thank you for being a part of Team!

subject: Chairman's Update October 9th
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
October 9, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good morning, Pennsylvania.
My spirits are up this week because President Trump and the First Lady are having a speedy recovery. President Trump is back to work in the White House. I am also happy to say I am confident that Pennsylvania is staying red this November! As I watch Republican voter registration surpass Democratic registration numbers, I become more confident in our success.
In a recent interview with 90.5 WESA, I explained Republican voter registration numbers have skyrocketed. This further proves President Trump can easily win Pennsylvania again when we compare to 2016 numbers. He won Pennsylvania by 44,000 votes and we now have 160,000 new Republicans registered in the state. Democrats are shrugging off the numbers. Let‚Äôs show them that numbers don‚Äôt lie on Nov. 3. Here comes the red wave!
‚Üí Read More: State Republicans ‚Äòconfident‚Äô Pennsylvania will go for Trump, says PA party chair (WESA)
‚Üí Read More: Pennsylvania GOP closed voter registration gap by over 160K since 2016, but Dems point to 2020 new voter edge (Fox News)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### A slight win for Republicans against Governor Wolf üí™
Governor Wolf has slightly lifted crowd restrictions for indoor and outdoor events. However, he does not plan to ease up until there is a vaccine or cure for the virus. Dr. Rachel Levine also noted they could roll back these restrictions if they feel the virus is spreading too much. The Wolf administration has a hard time giving up executive power.
Meanwhile, the next fight against Gov. Wolf‚Äôs effort to change the rules heats up as Republican legislators attempt to keep our election fair and uncompromised. Republicans want to create an ‚Äòelection integrity‚Äô committee to look into the election with all the new changes. Gov. Wolf views the creation of the committee as a threat to the election. We saw the chaos caused by early voting in Philadelphia. What‚Äôs the harm in making sure our election process is fair and trusted, Gov. Wolf?
‚Üí Read more: Pennsylvania Republicans propose ‚Äòelection integrity‚Äô committee amid voting concerns (Fox News)
#### We will miss Senator Toomey üò¢
Senator Pat Toomey announced he would not run for reelection in the Senate. Sen. Toomey has represented the Commonwealth since 2011. He assured voters he hopes to work with President Trump in the near future. He stated, ‚ÄúI hope to be serving these last two years with President Donald Trump having been reelected. I support his campaign and I support his reelection.‚Äù Although we won‚Äôt have Toomey in the Senate in 2022, we still have him fighting for Pennsylvanians for the next two years.
‚Üí Read more: Toomey announces retirement at end of 2022 (The Hill)
#### Different isn't working üëé
Attorney General Josh Shapiro calls Heather Hieldbaugh‚Äôs attempt to focus on Pennsylvanians ‚Äúlaughable.‚Äù Shapiro would rather sue President Trump and Little Sisters of the Poor instead of focusing on Pennsylvania‚Äôs rising crime. Heidelbaugh‚Äôs message is quite simple: Don‚Äôt be a legislator, be a lawyer for the citizens. Shapiro characterized Heidelbaugh‚Äôs critiques of his suing frenzy as ‚Äúdownright cynical.‚Äù Perhaps Shapiro needs to be reminded that his authority comes from the people of PA.
He proudly stated that he ran and won to be a ‚Äúdifferent kind of attorney general.‚Äù Well, Shapiro, Pennsylvania doesn‚Äôt need a ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù kind of attorney general. We need an attorney general who has legal experience and cares about the issues at home \-- not in Washington. Heidelbaugh has 36 years of experience in the courtroom, while Shapiro has zero.
Our Commonwealth needs an experienced attorney general because ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù is not working.
‚Üí Read here: The difference between Heidelbaugh and Shapiro is staggering (WESA)
‚Üí Read here: Heidelbaugh calls our potential fraud with mail-in ballots (WTAE)
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Read this: Law enforcement officers band together to celebrate a true war hero‚Äôs 100th birthday üôè (Fox News)
