subject: Chairman's Update July 16th
body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
July 16, 2020
This is a new weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good evening, Pennsylvania.
I hope everyone has had a great week. We are less than four months away from Election Day. We need all hands on deck going into these last three months to help get President Trump re-elected and put our qualified statewide and local candidates in office.
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Can we really trust Josh Shapiro?
Pennsylvania House Republicans called on Attorney General Josh Shapiro to consider legal action against Governor Wolf for forcing nursing homes to readmit coronavirus patients. Gov. Wolf followed in the footsteps of Gov. Cuomo (NY) and Gov. Whitmer (MI), both of whom have been notoriously known for mishandling the coronavirus pandemic within their states. More than 4,500 Pennsylvanians have suffered on account of Gov. Wolf‚Äôs deadly nursing home order.
AG Shapiro‚Äôs office responded to House Republicans on July 6 stating they acknowledge the concerns brought against Gov. Wolf and will conduct a thorough investigation into any foul play. Can we really trust Shapiro to do his job? Keep in mind, Shapiro is a textbook career politician who is just using the position of AG as a stepping stone to run for governor. Not to mention Shapiro is buddy-buddy with Gov. Wolf, so can we really trust his office to run a detailed investigation at Gov. Wolf‚Äôs expense? Hard Pass.
‚Üí Read more: AG Shapiro's office briefs House Republicans on nursing home coronavirus investigation ([[URL REDACTED]])
#### Toomey works across aisle to help small businesses affected by riots üî•
U.S. Senator Pat Toomey is working with Rep. Dwight Evans (PA-03) to help small businesses in cities such as Philadelphia that were damaged during recent riots. We applaud Sen. Toomey for recognizing the importance of assisting Pennsylvania‚Äôs small businesses after they were unfairly broken into and vandalized.
The fact of the matter is, civil unrest and ‚Äúpeaceful protests‚Äù should have never gotten this far. The only statement that vandalizing small businesses sends is a bank statement to your local business owner. Now, unfortunately, we have to put forth more time and more energy to repair the damage that was done. With Sen. Toomey and Rep. Evans‚Äô Helping Entrepreneurs Access Loans (HEAL) Act, communities are able to be lifted up by the success of their small businesses.
‚Üí Read more: Toomey-Evans‚Äô bipartisan HEAL Act would provide a lifeline to small businesses damaged during civil unrest (U.S. Senate)
#### Speaker Cutler discusses bipartisanship, fair elections and more üôå
Speaker Cutler spoke with Jon Delano of KDKA TV about how he finds success in his work. The answer? Bipartisanship. Speaker Cutler stated his whole time in the Pennsylvania Legislature has been about finding people to work with on both sides.
‚ÄúMy whole approach up there during my entire tenure has really been the same. I try to find those areas where there‚Äôs some commonality and some common ground. I always try to find a Democrat to work on major issues with,‚Äù  Speaker Cutler told Delano.
This is the kind of leadership we need in Congress.
‚Üí Read more: Meet Pa. House Speaker Bryan Cutler: A farmer, a triathlete, a leader who never forgets his mistakes (PA Post)
#### Giving Gov. Wolf one last chance...
The Pennsylvania Legislature recently delivered House Resolution 836 to Gov. Wolf‚Äôs desk, which calls to end his emergency declarations. This comes after Gov. Wolf‚Äôs legal attempts to block the bill which, by the way, has bipartisan support. Senate President Scarnati and Majority Leader Jake Corman made the following statement on the matter:
‚ÄúBy presenting HR 836 to Governor Wolf for signature, we are hopeful he will abandon his attempt to govern on his own and begin to work with the legislature to do what is in the best interest of all Pennsylvanians."
Gov. Wolf needs to understand we have a democratic system built on checks and balances, and it is not a place for his authoritarian-style ‚Äúleadership.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Resolution to terminate emergency declaration sent to Wolf (PA Senate)
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Watch this: We dare you not to burst with American pride after watching this‚Ä¶ ‚úàÔ∏è (YouTube)

body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
August 10, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good morning, Pennsylvania.
Happy August! We have only 3 months before the November election. Now is the time to start thinking of what you can do to help Pennsylvania stay red this fall. With our weekly newsletter here at the Pennsylvania Republican Party, we hope to provide you with enough updates on Republican leadership that you can share with your friends, family and peers.
We value dedicated civilians like you to keep our democracy alive.
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Republican voter surge in Pennsylvania üìà
The Philadelphia Inquirer reported that Republicans have gained 165,000 voters since the last presidential election year. This is five times the number Democrats have registered between now and 2016. While Democrats overall have more voters registered in Pennsylvania, here is what I told The Philadelphia Inquirer: ‚ÄúWe have since picked up and narrowed the gap between us and the Democrats [by 135,000]. So we were already ahead 44,000, and look what we‚Äôve picked up. I predict we‚Äôre going to narrow the gap further between now and November.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Joe Biden leads in a new Pennsylvania poll, but many are wary of ‚Äòsecret Trump voters‚Äô (The Philadelphia Inquirer)
#### Anti-Semitism has no place here ‚ùå
Sen. Toomey called out Philadelphia NAACP President, Minister Rodney Muhammad for sharing an anti-Semitic post on Facebook on July 28. Statewide officials have even called for Muhammad‚Äôs resignation, even though Muhammad denies any malintent from sharing the post.
The post, which is now deleted, showed images of several celebrities ‚Äî who have all made anti-Semitic remarks lately ‚Äî along with a caricature of a yarmulke-wearing figure crushing people with a hook-turned hand. There is no mistaking this kind of blatant disregard for the Jewish community.
‚Üí Read more: Black and Jewish leaders blast the NAACP‚Äôs Philly president for an anti-Semitic Facebook post (The Philadelphia Inquirer)
#### Gov. Wolf denies transparency in the Legislature üôÑ
The Lancaster County Republican Delegation, led by Speaker Cutler, called on Governor Wolf to sign the Legislature‚Äôs proposed government transparency bill. This bill would require the governor to have open discussions with the Legislature should an emergency declaration be thought of. It would also hold the governor accountable in the eyes of the media and Pennsylvanians, as we have a right to know what decisions are being made in regards to our livelihood.
The Lancaster County Republican Delegation said the following on the matter:
‚ÄúNo one person has the capacity to govern and issue mandates that affect the lives and livelihoods of millions of citizens across a diverse state during an emergency. It was for these circumstances that our Founders created three co-equal branches of government. We urge the governor to listen to the voices of unemployed Pennsylvanians, small business owners and those who have lost family members due to COVID-19.‚Äù
‚Üí Read more: Lancaster County delegation urges Governor to sign transparency bill (WDAC Radio)

body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
October 16, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Good afternoon, Pennsylvania.
President Trump is back on the road after fully recovering from the coronavirus. Where was President Trump‚Äôs first campaign stop after recovering? The great Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, of course! President Trump spoke to an electrified crowd in Johnstown who showed their support by chanting, ‚ÄúFour more years!‚Äù
A merchandise store owner and supporter, Diana Lohr, noted at the rally, ‚ÄúI've had people coming on buses from as far as Ohio, Indiana and Erie, Pennsylvania, to get a glimpse of [the president]. All of them wanting to ‚ÄòKeep America Great.‚Äù One thing is for sure -- President Trump draws a crowd. With less than three weeks until Election Day, the fight is clear. Pennsylvania is arguably the most critical state to win in this election.
I urge you to get out and vote. Tell your friends and family to vote. Do everything you can to keep PA red!
‚Üí Read More: President Trump holds rally at Johnstown airport (WJAC)
‚Üí Read More: Large crowd gathers to see President Trump in Johnstown, Pa. (York Daily Record)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Governor Wolf against ACB, pro-ACA üëé
Governor Wolf and his Democratic colleagues oppose President Trump‚Äôs Supreme Court Justice nominee Amy Coney Barrett. Gov. Wolf criticized Senator Toomey for entertaining the idea of considering President Trump‚Äôs nominee. The hearings began this week and in typical left-wing fashion, the Democrats attacked Judge Barrett. They shamed Judge Barrett for not answering her specific thoughts on politically charged questions. I am wondering, do the Senate Democrats and mainstream media not realize it is a Supreme Court Justice‚Äôs job to be 100% impartial?
Democrats like Gov. Wolf are pushing a lie that Republicans do not support protecting those with pre-existing conditions. It is quite interesting that a sitting governor is getting involved in the Supreme Court nomination process. Gov. Wolf spoke with Senator Casey on plans to preserve Obamacare. Wolf stated, ‚ÄúThe most important thing we can do right now to protect health care for Pennsylvanians is to protect the ACA.‚Äù Gov. Wolf should focus on the economic destruction he created with his lockdowns and restrictions instead of focusing on D.C. issues.
‚Üí Read more: Governor Wolf attacks Senator Toomey (Fox News)
#### Senator Toomey supports ACBüôå
Governor Wolf will be disappointed to hear that Senator Toomey supports Judge Amy Coney Barrett for Supreme Court Justice. Judge Barrett impressively answered all the questions the Senate Judiciary Committee asked for the past three days. She had zero notes. Her qualifications are impeccable but the Democrats oppose her nomination for political reasons only. They are calling it a ‚Äúsham.‚Äù
Sen. Toomey called out the pettiness of the Senate Democrats during the hearings. He stated, ‚ÄúUnfortunately, Senate Democrats continue to embarrass themselves by insisting that the next Supreme Court Justice disregard the law and the Constitution by acting as an unelected super legislator who imposes the Democrats‚Äô preferred policy outcomes.‚Äù
Senator Toomey supports Judge Barrett‚Äôs nomination because he believes in preserving the Constitution and defending our liberties.
‚Üí Read more: Judge Barrett‚Äôs Confirmation is ‚ÄúWell-Deserved‚Äù ([[URL REDACTED]])
#### Pro-law and order candidates üö® üöî
Heather Heidelbaugh is on the campaign trail in Erie. During this stop, Heidelbaugh vowed to focus on law enforcement as attorney general. The radical left‚Äôs agenda has pushed to defund our police. Heidelbaugh wants PA district attorneys to bring solutions to rising crime rates in our cities -- unlike Josh Shapiro. Shapiro does not condemn riots in our state nor assist law enforcement in handling the violence. Shapiro is too busy preparing for a gubernatorial race in 2022.
Heidelbaugh is not the only GOP candidate supporting our police -- Sean Parnell is right there with her. Parnell recently had a ‚ÄúBack the Blue‚Äù rally and the turnout was great! Parnell challenged his opponent Conor Lamb‚Äôs silence during the riots and violence. The Democratic Party is extremely vocal about defunding the police but who do they still call when they‚Äôre in trouble? That‚Äôs right, the police.
The Republican Party supports our police officers proudly and boldly. Vote straight red to keep our state safe.
‚Üí Read here: Heidelbaugh will bring back law and order (YourErie)
#### A piece of positivity:
‚Üí Read this: Police officer saves choking baby -- so thankful for these everyday heroes üôè (Fox News)

###

* * *
September 16, 2020
* * *
Friend,
The almighty ‚ÄúKing Wolf‚Äù was FINALLY ruled unconstitutional by a federal judge.
Governor Wolf ruled unconstitutional!
Keep Gov. Wolf in check ‚òëÔ∏è
We have lost track of just how many months Pennsylvania has been under Gov. Wolf‚Äôs executive orders.
The Trump-appointed federal judge‚Äôs ruling decided that in a crisis, executive privilege can only go so far before it turns into executive abuse.
I agree.
Gov. Wolf‚Äôs office plans to appeal the ruling. See this is the disturbing part. Shouldn‚Äôt the governor follow and respect the Constitution while listening to the people of our great Commonwealth?
By immediately deciding to repeal this decision, it is clear Gov. Wolf does NOT respect the Constitution and he does NOT listen to what the people of Pennsylvania want -- despite these two key facets making up the majority of his job description.
Gov. Wolf thinks he is untouchable. This is extremely concerning for the people of Pennsylvania.
Not to mention, Gov. Wolf believes he has been Pennsylvania‚Äôs knight in shining armor against the coronavirus. Gov. Wolf was literally pushing to legalize marijuana in the middle of a pandemic.
Instead of reopening our businesses, Wolf was walking in anti-police protests and pushing for the legalization of marijuana!
There are no words to describe how little sense this makes.
Executive privilege can only get you so far. Do you think Gov. Wolf‚Äôs executive abuse should be checked?
>>> YES! Keep Gov. Wolf‚Äôs abuse of executive power in check ‚òëÔ∏è
We, as Republicans, need to look after our Commonwealth and stand up against the radicals of the left. This should only motivate us even more to elect more conservatives to office this November.
Will you help stand up to Gov. Wolf‚Äôs unchecked abuse of power?

body_text:
Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.Welcome to the "Chairman's Update," a weekly recap filling you in on the latest statewide party news.
* * *
Chairman's Update
October 2, 2020
This is a weekly update from Pennsylvania Republican Party Chairman Lawrence Tabas filling you in on what our statewide party leaders are up to, along with relevant news pertaining to the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
The Pennsylvania Republican Party is sending our best well wishes to President Trump and First Lady Melania Trump. We wish them a speedy recovery and are keeping their families in our prayers.
Let‚Äôs continue to uplift all who have been impacted by the coronavirus.
Good evening, Pennsylvania.
Recently, the Atlantic published a story riddled with false accusations against me and the Pennsylvania Republican Party. The article takes my words and twists them in typical fake news fashion. Let me be crystal clear; I want every single vote cast by Pennsylvanians to be counted fairly. I have not had conversations with the Trump administration about the state legislature appointing electors. I believe President Trump will win Pennsylvania with a clear majority. The only strategy is to get out and vote!
I am urging you all to go to the polls and cast your vote. Our Republican candidates need your support and help against the radical left and fake news media. The only way PA will go red is if you vote!
‚Üí Read More: Clarification on the Atlantic article (National Review)
DONATE NOW
Sincerely,
Lawrence J. Tabas
Chairman, Pennsylvania Republican Party
#### Governor Wolf‚Äôs dangerous policies üö®
Another week another fight between Democratic Governor Wolf and the GOP lawmakers. Gov. Wolf claims the GOP is attempting to stop him from saving lives. It seems the Democrats‚Äô favorite word of the week is ‚Äúdangerous.‚Äù It is ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù to let parents watch their children play sports. It is ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù to ease restrictions on restaurants and bars. It is ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù to let Pennsylvanians decide what is best for them.
The GOP continues to fight for small businesses and families struggling through the heavy restrictions. Senate spokeswoman Jenn Kocker reacted to Gov. Wolf‚Äôs rhetoric, ‚ÄúWolf calling the high school sports bill ‚Äòdangerous‚Äô shows how out of touch Governor Wolf really is.‚Äù Pennsylvanians want to open up the Commonwealth. Gov. Wolf should work with the PA Legislature instead of grandstanding.
It is clear Gov. Wolf‚Äôs policies are the real danger to PA‚Äôs economy.
‚Üí Read more: Wolf calls common-sense legislation dangerous (PennLive)
‚Üí Watch here: Gov. Wolf and Representative Ullman call masks ‚ÄúPolitical Theater‚Äù (YouTube)
#### Sen. Toomey leads fight against Wolf üëä
Senator Pat Toomey announced he would nominate President Trump's Supreme Court Justice pick, Amy Coney Barrett. Gov. Wolf does not support Sen. Toomey‚Äôs decision agreeing to hold nomination hearings for Judge Barrett. Gov. Wolf stated, ‚ÄúIt would be an unconscionable error to rush into a nomination when the people of Pennsylvania and the nation as a whole make clear their wishes for the future of our country in a few short weeks.‚Äù Sen. Toomey is not taking Gov. Wolf‚Äôs on this topic. Fill that seat, Toomey!
Sen. Toomey, along with other PA Republicans, is urging Gov. Wolf to allow fans to attend sporting events. Within the letter, they write, ‚ÄúThe Commonwealth‚Äôs arbitrary 250-person limit on outdoor gatherings is needlessly preventing Pennsylvanians from responsibly enjoying sports events and should be adjusted immediately.‚Äù The governor‚Äôs office has received the letter but -- not surprisingly -- dismissed it. Governor Wolf clearly doesn‚Äôt think Pennsylvanians can use common sense to watch an outdoor football game.
‚Üí Read more: Gov. Wolf asks Senator Toomey to wait on Supreme Court Justice (CBS)
‚Üí Read more: Toomey and Republicans urge Wolf to open up sports (PennLive)
#### Republican candidates close in on opponents üôå
A new poll shows 5% of voters are undecided on who to vote for in the attorney general election. Attorney General Josh Shapiro only has a 3% lead over Heidelbaugh. We need to continue getting Heidelbaugh's message out to get Shapiro out. It‚Äôs time Pennsylvania has an experienced lawyer in the attorney general‚Äôs office.
Another heated race, Sean Parnell versus Rep. Conor Lamb, spared off in a debate. Lamb focused on attacking Parnell for pointing out the faults in Obamacare. Parnell attacked Lamb on his silence about the riots. He held nothing back, stating, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre out marching with ‚ÄòDefund the Police‚Äô radicals, and as far as I‚Äôm concerned, I find that reprehensible.‚Äù Parnell appealed to all voters, assuring them he will keep his promises -- unlike Lamb.
‚Üí Read here: Shapiro should be worried (Legal News)
‚Üí Read here: Parnell and Lamb hit the debate stage (TribLive)

subject: [LAST CALL] Only hours left to pledge for DNC Delegate
body_text:
You must complete the delegate pledge form by 5:00 PM TONIGHT, January 27th, if you would like to be a delegate in 2020. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Hi PA Democrats,
If you'd like to run to be a 2020 DNC delegate from Pennsylvania, your statement of candidacy and presidential preference must be received by 5:00 PM Eastern tonight, January 27th!
The simplest and most reliable way to submit your candidacy before tonight's deadline is via the online pledge form at [[URL REDACTED]]
PLEDGE BY 5:00 PM ‚Üí
To be considered for delegate, you must be a registered Democratic voter in Pennsylvania and know your PA congressional district. You can click here to check your voter registration status and find your congressional district here.
If you have any questions about being a delegate or PA Democrats' delegate selection process, please view our Delegate Selection Plan or write to [[URL REDACTED]]
PLEDGE BY 5:00 PM ‚Üí
All the best,
Corey Pellington
Deputy Executive Director | PA Democratic Party

subject: Friend, Become a Delegate to the 2020 DNC
body_text:
Run to be a Delegate at the 2020 Democratic National Convention by completing our Delegate Pledge Form by January 27, 2020. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Friend,
As proud Pennsylvania Democrats, we believe our diversity makes us stronger. That's why today I'm proud to announce the release of Pennsylvania's 2020 Delegate Pledge form.
In order to be considered as a delegate, pledge your support for one of our candidates today!
Democrats from across the country will travel to the Badger State in July to unite behind the next Democratic nominee for President of the United States, and I'm excited we're able to release pledge forms almost a month early to ensure the most diverse and inclusive delegation in Milwaukee.
Become a delegate to the 2020 Democratic Nation Convention by pledging your support for one of our candidates today!
If you want to represent Pennsylvania as a delegate, follow these easy steps:
* BE A REGISTERED DEMOCRAT:
You can update your voter registration online here.
* KNOW YOUR CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICT:
You can find your congressional district here.
* COMPLETE A PRESIDENTIAL DELEGATE PLEDGE FORM:
You can fill out the pledge form online here. You can also print and mail a copy of the form to PO Box 22356, Philadelphia, PA 19110 here.
The Pennsylvania Democratic Party must receive pledge forms no later than 5 PM on Monday, January 27th.
* AFTER YOU SUBMIT:
The presidential candidates have the right of approval over who may run as a delegate or alternate pledged to their candidacy. Individuals approved as delegates will be notified on January 29, 2020.
Any questions can be sent to Corey Pellington at [[URL REDACTED]]
To Victory,
Nancy Patton Mills
Chairwoman | PA Democratic Party

subject: a personal request
body_text:
National Republicans have been preparing for this election for years. Now, they're ready to spend big, and they have their sights set on these four critical states.
PA Dems
Hi there,
The 2020 election will be the most consequential in generations. The future of our country and our democracy are at stake.
With Donald Trump and the GOP in control, we‚Äôve seen rampant attacks on voting rights, huge steps back in our fight against the climate crisis, and now a complete failure of leadership in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The American people need us to act, and act fast!
That‚Äôs why today I'm personally reaching out to you to ask that you support Democrats in four key battleground states‚ÄîArizona, Florida, Nevada, and Pennsylvania‚Äîby splitting a contribution to their state Democratic parties.
* * *
If you've already saved payment information with ActBlue Express, your contribution will be processed immediately. Your gift will be split among the state parties in AZ, FL, PA, and NV.
$20$50$100OTHER
* * *
Here‚Äôs why this is so important: National Republicans have been prepping for this election for years‚Äîfilling their deep pockets with special interest and dark money while breaking fundraising records across the board.
Now, they‚Äôre ready to spend big, and they have their sights set on these four critical states. They know Democrats in Pennsylvania, Nevada, Florida, and Arizona stand between them and another four years of Donald Trump.
Let‚Äôs prove them right. Donate today and ensure Democratic state parties have the resources to deliver big wins up and down the ballot on Election Day and finally get this country back on track.
I know these are difficult times for our nation, but we will get through them as we always do: by coming together, as Americans, to fight for a better future.
Thank you,
Elizabeth Warren

body_text:
State Republicans just voted to force PA back to work against the advice of doctors, scientists, and frontline labor leaders. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Democrats,
Harrisburg Republicans just voted to force Pennsylvanians back to work against the advice of doctors, scientists, and frontline labor leaders.
They put profits over people in the middle of a global pandemic. If not for Governor Wolf, we'd be staring down a new surge of sickness and death‚Äîall to appease CEO donors sitting miles from the factory floor.
Together, we can put these anti-science, anti-worker profiteers on notice. Chip in to turn Harrisburg back to blue in November.
* * *
If you've already saved your payment information with ActBlue Express, your contribution will be processed immediately:
$8$20$50$100OTHER

Let's just speak the truth: state Republicans don't give a damn about PA workers.
They're enforcing America's lowest minimum wage. They rejected state Democrats' plans for hazard pay and sick leave. And now they want to force workers back long before it's safe.
That's a message that will resonate with voters everywhere, and it's a message we need your help getting out.
If you donate today, we'll put your gift to work educating voters about the importance of a Democratic legislature. Please contribute to flip Harrisburg in 2020!

subject: Bernie endorsed Joe for president! Are you with them?
body_text:
Joe and Bernie just outlined Democrats' bold plan for America and the big changes we can all win together. Bernie says we need Joe in the White House! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
I'M VOTING BLUE!
* * *
Friends: We need Joe Biden in the White House.
It's time to unite our party around bright ideas and big solutions from every part of our coalition. Only then can we work together to defeat Trump and secure big Democratic wins at every level.
Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders both know that, and today Bernie endorsed Joe during a joint Facebook Live! Together, they outlined Joe's plan for America and the big changes we can all win together, like:
‚úì A $15 minimum wage for every worker
‚úì Making the wealthy pay their fair share
‚úì Combating GOP voter suppression
‚úì Strengthening America's labor unions
‚úì Groundbreaking student debt forgiveness
(And that's just the beginning.)
Team, Donald Trump and his party are already trying to pull us apart, but the truth is that we have far more in common than we do that divides us.
Joe Biden has the vision and experience to unite our party around our shared ideals, and he will lead America to a safer, fairer, and more prosperous union.
ADD YOUR NAME if you endorse Joe Biden for President of the United States!
SIGN YOUR NAME

subject: "We have to do both." | A note on George Floyd and the PA Primary
body_text:
If you are a Delaware County voter who has not yet returned your at-home ballot, you can now do so at any of Delaware County's in-person polling locations on Primary Day! Click here to find a polling
PA Dems
Fellow Democrats,
The past few days have been difficult for Pennsylvania and our entire nation. The unconscionable murder of George Floyd was only the latest painful incident in an exhausting, centuries-long string of racist violence in America.
We hear all those who are speaking out, and we stand with all those who are peacefully protesting across our commonwealth.
And while we recognize it will take far more than an election to overcome the deeply rooted racism within our country, voting remains a crucial tool in our fight for justice.
In a beautiful essay he published today, President Obama reminded us our voices must be heard everywhere‚Äîboth in the streets and in the ballot box.
So Democrats, we're writing to urge you to make your voice heard in the PA Primary tomorrow.
If you're voting from home, make a plan to return your mail ballot.
If you're going at the polls, make sure you make a plan and confirm your polling place.
And if you're ready to take the next step, sign up to call voters in your community tonight and tomorrow.
We will not right the wrongs of racism with anything less than a sustained and multiracial movement for change in our homes, in Harrisburg, and in Washington DC.
As President Obama said, we can't fix the problems plaguing our nation with activism or voting alone. We have to do both.
And with your help, we will.
Onward,
The PA Democratic Party
FIND BALLOT DROPOFFFIND POLLING PLACE
CALL VOTERS FROM HOME

Today marks exactly one hundred days until in-person polls open and mail ballots are due. Until then, we need to spend every moment we can working hard to ensure victory November 3rd.
These fourteen weeks will be gone in a blink, folks, and we can't afford to look back on them wishing we'd done more. That's why, this very moment, we're calling voters across PA about voting to save the soul of our nation.

PA Dems
PA Democrats,
Flipping both chambers of the state legislature is a top priority in 2020. On Tuesday, January 14, we can take an early step toward that goal by electing Michael Schroeder for PA Senate.
* * *
CONTRIBUTE NOW
Donations fund organizing and outreach to turn Harrisburg completely blue.

subject: Governor Wolf's Plan for PA [COVID-19 Update & Resources]
body_text:
This email contains resources for you and your family, plus state Democrats' plan to defeat and move beyond COVID-19. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Hi everyone,
On Friday, Governor Wolf and state health officials released their plan to defeat COVID-19 and lead Pennsylvania back to prosperity.
It's a plan backed by science, data, and the needs of everyday people, and we think it's important that every Pennsylvanian read it to understand the road ahead.
* * *
READ THE PLAN
* * *
The Wolf Administration has outlined its approach in three phases: Relief for families and businesses right now, Reopening when it's safe and sensible, and Recovery to build our economy stronger than ever.
RELIEF
Before we can move forward, we have to care for ourselves and our neighbors now. That's why Governor Wolf's plan starts with steps and resources to support workers, businesses, and care providers.
If you or your loved ones could use a little help, here are some quick links to get it:
‚Üí Find food assistance.
‚Üí Learn more about unemployment benefits.
‚Üí Learn about and request student loan help.
‚Üí Seek help for mental health.
‚Üí Explore resources for businesses.
REOPENING
We all want things back to normal, but without a measured and responsible plan to get there, we risk losing more lives and all the progress we‚Äôve sacrificed for.
To safely reopen PA, Governor Wolf and Health Secretary Levine have outlined six standards we must follow along the way.
RECOVERY
Finally, Governor Wolf's plan charts a course for Pennsylvania's future beyond COVID-19. And rather than return to the past, his agenda aims for a commonwealth stronger and more equitable than ever before.
The COVID-19 recovery plan outlines dozens of initiatives to get families and business back up to speed, while ensuring we're better prepared for future crises. Highlights include:
‚Üí A $12 minimum wage, gradually rising to $15/hour
‚Üí Expanded sick leave, family leave, and hazard pay
‚Üí Expanded student loan support/forgiveness
‚Üí Substantial new investments in job creation
‚Üí Additional funding/grants for small businesses
* * *
Know this, fellow Democrats: Together, we can defeat COVID-19 and emerge even stronger on the other side.
The Plan For Pennsylvania gives us the best opportunity at doing so. Thank you for supporting it and the Democratic leaders we need to see it through!
All our best,
Sincer√© Harris
Executive Director | PA Democrats
READ THE PLAN
* * *

subject: It's time to return your mail ballot in person.
body_text:
The best way to ensure your ballot arrives on time is to deliver it in person, rather than by mail. You may deliver your ballot until 8 PM on Election Day, 11/3. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Over the next few days, we'll send lots of info about returning ballots and voting in person. Click here to let us know if you've already voted and returned your ballot.
Democrats ‚Äî With one week until polls close and USPS experiencing some delays, the most surefire way to return your ballot on time is delivering it in person at your county elections office or, if your county allows, at a dropbox or satellite office.
Make a plan to return your ballot in person. ‚Üí Start by finding your county elections office, a dropbox, or a nearby voting center.
* * *
FIND DROPOFF POINTS
* * *
Before you return your ballot, remember to seal it in the white secrecy envelope and then the larger return envelope. Then, complete and sign the Voter Declaration on the back of the return envelope.
You may only return your own ballot. If you or another voter needs a ride or other support to vote, please call our Voter Assistance Hotline at 1-833-PA-VOTES (833-728-6837).
* * *
Already mailed your ballot?
If your ballot is already in the mail, it's very likely to be delivered on time. Track its status at [[URL REDACTED]] and call 833-PA-VOTES with questions or concerns as Election Day approaches.
* * *
[[URL REDACTED]]
* * *
NEED LIVE SUPPORT? Our Voter Assistance Hotline is staffed daily from now until Election Day. Call us!
1-833-PA-VOTES
(833-728-6837)

subject: Friends, Earth needs us to lead on climate change and elect more Democrats!
body_text:
Our planet can't survive four more years of Republican anti-science policy. That's why we have to work day and night to flip the Pennsylvania legislature and to defeat Donald Trump in November
PA Dems
Happy Earth Day, fellow Democrats.
Today, as we celebrate the natural beauty of our commonwealth, we must also reflect on the need to address the urgent threats posed by climate change.
It's on all of us to keep up the good fight for clean energy and climate research. We must do all we can to protect our air and water, to preserve our oceans and waterways, and to save our forests and public lands so future generations of Pennsylvanians can marvel at the natural world around us.
Democrats know climate change is among our planet's greatest challenges, and we want to see America become the world‚Äôs clean energy superpower while creating millions of good-paying jobs.
Unfortunately, Donald Trump and his allies in Washington and Harrisburg are hell-bent on ignoring science.
Our planet can't survive four more years of Republican anti-science policy. That's why we have to work day and night to flip the Pennsylvania legislature and to defeat Donald Trump in November.
It will take all of us‚Äîstudents, scientists, and citizens‚Äîacting together to address the threat of climate change and keep our planet healthy for generations to come. Please join us.
All the best,
Dwayne Heisler
Caucus Chair
PA Democrats' Progressive Caucus

subject: Republicans will use the pandemic to suppress votes. Voting by mail is how we fight back.
body_text:
Thanks to Democratic leadership, Republicans can't stop you from voting by mail in PA. Open this email and click to request your mail-in ballot online right now! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Fellow Democrats ‚Äî The Republican Party is using a global pandemic to suppress the vote everywhere they can.
In Pennsylvania...
Speaker Mike Turzai flagrantly put voters and democracy at risk when he forced special elections to take place amidst social distancing last month.
In Wisconsin...
Republicans fought all the way to the WI Supreme Court to stop safety measures in the WI primary. Then, they fought all the way to the US Supreme Court to disenfranchise mail-in voters.
And in Washington DC...
Trump admitted on live TV that he opposes making voting easier because "you'd never have a Republican elected in this country again."
But thanks to Democratic leadership, Republicans can't stop you from voting by mail in PA. Request your mail-in ballot online right now!
* * *
SIGN UP TO VOTE BY MAIL
* * *
Voting by mail is an easy three-step process that's available to any registered voter in Pennsylvania:
1) Use [[URL REDACTED]] to start the sign-up process.
2) Mark the ballot mailed to you. Put it in the secrecy envelope.
3) Return your ballot before 8 PM on Primary Day.
Please don't delay, voters! The sooner you request your ballot; the sooner you ensure that your vote is safely counted in the PA Primary set for June 2nd.
Use [[URL REDACTED]] to start the vote by mail process and find your Ballot Request Form!
REQUEST YOUR BALLOT

subject: Polls open in Pennsylvania | Your Primary Day Handbook
body_text:
Polls are open! ‚Üí What every voter needs to know about voting in the 2020 Pennsylvania Primary Election. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Friends, polls are now open for the 2020 Pennsylvania Primary Elections! Go vote for the Democratic leaders you want representing our party on the ballot this November.
* * *
WHERE CAN I VOTE?
Due to changes related to COVID-19, every Pennsylvania voter should confirm their assigned, in-person polling place.
Many counties have moved polling locations to ensure proper staffing, safety measures, and physical distancing. Please use the voter status lookup tool from PA Voter Services to confirm where you can vote.
FIND POLLING PLACE
WHEN CAN I VOTE?
Polls are open 7:00 AM ‚Äì 8:00 PM. If you're in line by 8 PM, stay in line; you're entitled to vote regardless of what time your ballot is actually cast.
RETURNING MAIL BALLOTS
If you were approved for a mail ballot, please make sure it's in your county's hands by 8:00 PM tonight. Find your county at [[URL REDACTED]] to determine when and where you can return your ballot.
NOTE: Unless you live in Delaware County, you may not return a mail ballot at your in-person polling place.
FIND DROPOFF SPOTS
MISSING/DAMAGED MAIL BALLOTS
If your mail ballot is missing or damaged, you can still vote in person! Please request a paper provisional ballot at your assigned polling location by 8:00 PM.
LEARN MORE
A NOTE ON COVID-19
Local officials and volunteers have worked around the clock to provide a safe, sanitary experience at every polling location.
See the PA Department of State's recommendations for guidance on on keeping yourself and other voters safe. You should also revisit the CDC's hygiene recommendations before heading out.
SEE SAFETY INFO
DO I NEED ID TO VOTE?
You only need a valid form of identification to vote if:
\- It's your first time voting in PA.
\- You haven't voted at your current location before.
Unless you meet one of those conditions, PA law does not require ID to vote. Call 833-728-6837 if you believe a polling official is requesting identification erroneously.
WHAT ARE MY VOTING RIGHTS?
Familiarize yourself with your voting rights before you hit the polls. Visit [[URL REDACTED]]
If you believe your right to vote has incorrectly been infringed or denied, immediately request a provisional ballot at the polling place and call PA Dems' voter support team at 833-PA-VOTES (833-728-6837).
Our phones are open 7:00 AM ‚Äì 8:00 PM on Election Days.
* * *
For other questions and concerns, please contact the state elections bureau at 1-877-868-3772 or [[URL REDACTED]]
You should also check out the Pennsylvania Department of State's Voter Guide.
* * *
CONTRIBUTE
VOLUNTEER
PAID FOR BY THE PENNSYLVANIA DEMOCRATIC PARTY. NOT AUTHORIZED BY ANY CANDIDATE OR CANDIDATE COMMITTEE. [[URL REDACTED]]

subject: Today's Supreme Court decision is great news, but it doesn't ensure total equality.
body_text:
In Pennsylvania, it's still legal to deny housing or other public services to LGBTQ+ people, and LGBTQ+ healthcare disparities are widening under Donald Trump. We need legislative action in Harrisburg
PA Dems
Democrats ‚Äî In a groundbreaking victory for LGBTQ+ Americans and allies, the Supreme Court just ruled that it's illegal to fire someone for being gay or transgender!
This is a major step forward for LGBTQ+ rights‚Äîone that we'll surely celebrate every Pride Month from here on. Still, we need to be clear that this does not guarantee full equality under the law.
In Pennsylvania, it's still legal to deny housing or other public services to LGBTQ+ people, and LGBTQ+ healthcare disparities are widening under Donald Trump. We need legislative action in Harrisburg to right those obvious wrongs.
The PA Fairness Act would do so. It's a Democratic bill that's been awaiting a vote in Harrisburg for years, but GOP leaders refuse even to allow debate on it, let alone pass it.
So today, send a message to Harrisburg Republicans: LGBTQ+ equality can not wait. Sign our petition to demand a vote on the PA Fairness Act and commit to voting out Republicans who oppose equality!
I DEMAND EQUALITY
Add your name to call for passage of the PA Fairness Act.
* * *

subject: Celebrate Juneteenth by supporting these racial justice orgs in PA.
body_text:
Celebrate Black lives and liberty by splitting a donation between Black Lives Matter and the ACLU of Pennsylvania. The fight for racial justice goes on, and these organizations are leading it. - - - -
PA Dems
Slavery didn't end quietly with the Emancipation Proclamation, or even once the Civil War finished, friends.
For too many Black Americans, freedom was denied long after Lincoln signed it into law. For the people of Galveston, whose liberation sparks today's holiday, it was thirty long and painful months before freedom promised became freedom realized.
And for millions of Black Americans today‚Äîthose wrongly imprisoned, unjustly oppressed, or denied their basic humanity‚Äîtrue freedom and equality still feel a long way away.
That's why we ask that you mark Juneteenth with a donation to Black Lives Matter and the ACLU of Pennsylvania. The fight for racial justice goes on, and these organizations are leading it.
* * *
If you've already saved your payment information with ActBlue Express, your contribution will be processed immediately. Your gift will be split evenly among the ACLU of Pennsylvania and Black Lives Matter Philadelphia.
$20$50$100OTHER
* * *
In our commonwealth, June 19th sadly marks another milestone of racial injustice. Two years ago today, a young Black Pennsylvanian named Antwon Rose Jr. was killed by police in Pittsburgh.
We know, now more than ever, that his death is part of a terrible pattern of police brutality against People of Color across America. As Democrats, we're committed to fighting for justice in Harrisburg, Washington DC, and towns across PA.
Partners like the ACLU and Black Lives Matter are crucial to the success of that fight. In honor of Juneteenth and Antwon Rose, please split a donation among them to continue the fight for justice in PA.
Black Americans' struggles and contributions across American history are impossible to measure! I am proud to mark them today, and I hope you will join me now and into the future.
Happy Juneteenth,
Sincer√© Harris
Executive Director | PA Dems
* * *
If you've already saved your payment information with ActBlue Express, your contribution will be processed immediately. Your gift will be split evenly among the ACLU of Pennsylvania and Black Lives Matter Philadelphia.
$20$50$100OTHER

subject: Poll workers needed for November.
body_text:
Today is National Poll Worker Recruitment Day! Poll workers are crucial to ensuring everyone's voice is heard in November, but this year we're facing a potential shortage due to COVID-19. - - - - - -
PA Dems
Hi Democrats,
Today is National Poll Worker Recruitment Day! Poll workers are crucial to ensuring everyone's voice is heard in November, but this year we're facing a potential shortage due to COVID-19.
If you're able, sign up to work the polls on November 3rd. It's one of the best things you can do to defend democracy on Election Day.

* * *
As a PA poll worker, you'll receive all the training you need and could make up to $200 per day! Best of all, you'll be doing something to make it easier for your community to vote!
Learn more about being a poll worker and apply now to make a difference November 3rd!
Onward,
PA Democrats

Hi Democrats,
Two days after promising a special session to address police brutality and racial injustice, Speaker Turzai announced today that he'll leave office on June 15th. He did not say whether his pledge to allow votes on police reform will be fulfilled.
And just like that, Pennsylvanians' hard-earned progress towards equal justice is thrown into doubt by unreliable, self-centered GOP leadership.
The only way to guarantee progress is by flipping Harrisburg to give Democrats the gavel! Chip in $20.20 today to help Dems win nine PA House and four PA Senate seats.

Turzai spent his final days in Harrisburg pushing extremist bills that endanger workers and undermine Governor Wolf's leadership during a pandemic. But after promising action on police reform bills that voters actually want, he's suddenly retiring and leaving progress unfulfilled.
Undoubtedly, PA House Republicans will replace Turzai with a leader just as craven and beholden to corporate interests.
Friends, keeping men like Mike Turzai from setting the agenda in our legislature is why we need to flip Harrisburg in November.
Together, let's make sure every PA voter knows the opportunity at hand in legislative races this year. Please donate to power organizing, outreach, and advertising to flip the statehouse!

subject: Bad news, Democrats.
body_text:
In just a few days, rent will be due again for millions of Americans, and unemployed workers' $600 boost in benefits will expire. Many of your PA neighbors--maybe even your family--will be at risk...
PA Dems
Bad news, Democrats.
In just a few days, rent will be due again for millions of Americans, and unemployed workers' $600 boost in benefits will expire. That may leave many of your PA neighbors, or perhaps even you, at risk of falling behind or unable to afford the basics.
It's not right, and it doesn't have to be this way! Democrats have a plan, the HEROES Act, to extend enhanced unemployment benefits and invest millions into PA communities fighting COVID-19.
ADD YOUR NAME to tell DC Republicans that we need to pass the HEROES Act!
* * *
SIGN THE PETITION
* * *
The HEROES Act extends enhanced unemployment benefits for millions of people who can't safely work because of the pandemic. It also:
‚úì  Sends another round of direct cash payments to everyday Americans
‚úì  Provides hazard pay for essential workers putting their lives on the line
‚úì  Halts foreclosures, evictions, and debt collection for 120 days or more
‚úì  Cancels up to $10,000 in student debt and freezes loan payments
‚úì  Invests billions in hospitals and local governments to fight COVID-19
American families should not be forced to choose between safety and financial security in a pandemic. Congressional Dems' bold action would allow us all to focus on what matters most: beating COVID-19 together.
Sign our petition to demand that Donald Trump, Mitch McConnell, and PA Republicans in Congress get to work! It's time to vote on and pass the HEROES Act.
ADD YOUR NAME
* * *

subject: Celebrating Pride Month in Pennsylvania.
body_text:
June is Pride Month, when we celebrate our thriving LGBTQ+ community and the movement that began with the 1969 Stonewall Uprising, led by pioneering LGBTQ+ activists including transgender women of col
PA Dems
Hi Fellow Democrats,
June is Pride Month, when we celebrate our thriving LGBTQ+ community and the movement that began with the 1969 Stonewall Uprising, led by pioneering LGBTQ+ activists including transgender women of color Marsha P. Johnson and Sylvia Rivera.
Those brave women laid the groundwork in our fight for equality in the face of violence and discrimination. It's because of their fight and their courage that I can celebrate the first anniversary of marriage to my partner next week!
Over 50 years on, the LGBTQ+ community is a vibrant and vital part of our commonwealth in towns large and small. And while we‚Äôve seen great strides since 1969, we must remain vigilant and continue to protect LGBTQ+ Pennsylvanians against discriminatory attacks from the right.
Together, we can elect Democrats who will step up to make sure LGBTQ+ folks are free to live authentic lives without fear of hate and violence.
The upcoming November election is our chance to flip the legislature and elect Democrats up and down the ballot‚Äîand to ensure we can protect every LGBTQ+ Pennsylvanian from the GOP‚Äôs attacks on our humanity.
If you believe in a future free from discrimination based on who you love or how you live authentically, commit to vote for Democrats at every level of our government this November.
From the state house to the White House, our elected officials have a duty to protect millions of LGBTQ+ Americans‚Äîlet‚Äôs make sure we elect folks ready to fight for our Democratic values.
In solidarity,
Rich Schweikart
Chair | NW Regional Caucus
PA Democratic Party

Folks ‚Äî A week after Mike Turzai left the capitol to cash in as a corporate lobbyist, Harrisburg Republicans selected his protege, Bryan Cutler, to be the next Speaker of the PA House.
For every corrupt stunt Turzai led this year, Cutler was right behind him. As Majority Leader, Cutler rallied the GOP behind a far-right agenda to sabotage Governor Wolf's work against coronavirus, allegedly going as far as covering up a COVID-19 case in his caucus.

In short, Republicans' new boss is same as the old boss: reckless, right-wing, regressive. Let's make his tenure a short one.

subject: ADD YOUR NAME to support Governor Wolf, Secretary Levine, and science.
body_text:
Trump and Harrisburg Republicans are attacking Governor Wolf for listening to experts and putting safety first. Let's show them where we stand. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Donald Trump, Pat Toomey, and Harrisburg Republicans are united against their newest common enemy. And no, it's not the virus that has killed nearly 90,000 Americans.
They've focused their attacks on Governor Tom Wolf and his administration that's trying to protect PA lives.
Rather than work on bipartisan solutions to a crisis impacting us all, the GOP has spent weeks undermining and verbally assaulting Democratic leadership. That's why we're launching new initiatives to show that voters stand firmly on the side of science and safety.
Get started by adding your name in support of social distancing, science, and a safe, steady reopening. Sign on now stand with Governor Wolf!
* * *
ADD YOUR NAME ‚Üí
* * *
With Donald Trump in Allentown today, we're expecting a new wave of attacks and disinformation against Governor Wolf and Secretary Levine. Here's what we've already beat back.
APRIL 15
Harrisburg Republicans try overriding COVID-19 mitigation efforts but are vetoed by Governor Wolf.
APRIL 20
GOP legislators speak at far-right ‚ÄúRe-Open PA‚Äù protests, where they make bizarre and misleading statements.
MAY 4
Republican Rep. Cris Dush, who is up for reelection in November, makes an outrageous claim likening the Wolf Administration to the Nazi Regime.
MAY 9
Republican Rep. Mike Jones, who is up for reelection in November, packs 150+ maskless people into an event where he claims that Republicans have Governor Wolf "on the ropes."
MAY 11
Donald Trump hits send on an inflammatory Tweet demanding "freedom" for Pennsylvania and attempting to undermine PA's safe, science-based reopening.
MAY 11
Twenty-five Harrisburg Republicans write a letter urging local officials to ignore the advice of medical experts and defy Governor Wolf's lawful orders.
Democrats, these partisan theatrics, which do nothing to help us defeat COVID-19, are sure to continue until we defeat the GOP in November, but we can take the wind from their sails if we stand up and push back right now.
Start by adding your name to say you support Governor Wolf and Secretary Levine's plan for a safe, science-based reopening‚Äînot the GOP recklessness that will only extend this crisis.
STAND WITH SCIENCE
* * *

subject: Why Joe chose Kamala.
body_text:
In times like this, our party and our nation need leaders who are smart, tough, and ready for action. That's precisely why Joe Biden chose Kamala Harris to be the next Vice President! - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Fellow Democrats ‚Äî Under the failed leadership of Donald Trump, Americans are faced with three crises at once: a devastating pandemic, a nationwide reawakening to systemic racism, and the greatest economic crash since the Great Depression.
In times like this, our party and our nation need leaders who are smart, tough, and ready for action. That's precisely why Joe Biden chose Kamala Harris to be the next Vice President!
The daughter of Jamaican and Indian immigrants, Kamala has talked often about her experiences growing up as a Black girl. Those experiences made her stronger, and make her the kind of leader we need to beat back bigotry and injustice.
As a lawyer and Attorney General, Kamala led one of the biggest legal departments in the nation‚Äîwhere she was a powerful advocate for people in taking on the big banks and protecting women and kids from abuse.
And as a US Senator, she has been on the front lines of the fight against Donald Trump. We've all seen her fight fearlessly to hold the White House accountable, stand up to a Justice Department run amok, and speak out powerfully against extremist nominations.
Joe has often said he needs a Vice President that can lead with him on day one. Kamala Harris is ready and able.
With our support, the Biden-Harris ticket will lead Pennsylvania Back to Blue in November and rebuild America better than before. Please split a donation between their campaign and ours to power a complete Democratic victory.

subject: Under one week to vote early, in-person!!!
body_text:
Tuesday, October 27th is the last day that Pennsylvania voters can vote early, in-person at a county elections office or early voting center. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Over the next two weeks, we'll send lots of info about returning ballots and voting in person. Click here to let us know if you've already voted and returned your ballot.
Hi there ‚Äî Don't forget that every Pennsylvania voter can cast their ballot early, in-person until next Tuesday, October 27th, at 5 PM.
If you plan to vote early at your county elections office or another early voting center, find an early voting location in your county and make a plan to get there ASAP!
* * *
SEE EARLY VOTING SITES
* * *
Voting early, in-person is one of the new, easy, and flexible ways to have your voice heard. Just head to your county elections office, request your ballot in person, complete it, and hand it back on the spot.
Don't forget to seal your vote in two envelopes‚Äîthe secrecy and the return envelope‚Äîand complete and sign the Voter Declaration, even if you're voting in person.
Sound easy? It is, but you only have a few more days to do so! After October 27th, you can no longer request a ballot before Election Day.
Get started by using [[URL REDACTED]] to find your county elections office or another early voting center in your county.
Happy voting,
Kay Yu
Voter Protection Director
PA Democratic Party
[[URL REDACTED]]

subject: Polls are open! Here's your Election Day Voting Handbook.
body_text:
What every voter needs to know about voting in Pennsylvania's 2019 General Elections today. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
We're counting on top Democrats like you to keep voters informed. After reading this update, please fwd/share it with all the PA Democrats you know.
Fellow Pennsylvanians, polling places in every county are now open to vote for Joe Biden, Kamala Harris, and PA Democrats at every level! Go cast your vote, and reach out to friends to ensure they do the same.
* * *
WHEN CAN I VOTE IN PERSON?
Polls are open from 7:00 AM ‚Äì 8:00 PM. If you're in line at your polling location by 8:00 PM, stay in line! You're entitled to vote regardless of what time your ballot is actually cast.
WHERE CAN I VOTE IN PERSON?
Use the polling place lookup tool on [[URL REDACTED]] to find your voting location in a cinch! Note that many polling locations have changed this year, so double-check your assigned location even if you've voted at your current address before.
FIND POLLING PLACE
HOW CAN I RETURN MY MAIL BALLOT?
If you still have your mail ballot, return it by hand to your county elections office or dropbox by 8:00 PM. Unlike in-person voting, mail ballot dropoff must end promptly at 8:00 PM, even if voters are still in line.
FIND DROPOFF POINT
Remember to seal your ballot inside the secrecy envelope; then, complete and sign the Voter Declaration on the back of the return envelope!
WHAT IF I CAN'T RETURN MY BALLOT?
If you absolutely cannot return your ballot in person‚Äîwhether that's due to timing/location or your ballot not arriving‚Äîyou may still vote in person at your Election Day polling place.
If you have your ballot...
Take the ballot and its envelopes to your polling place, where it will be cancelled so you can vote on a machine.
If you don't have your ballot...
Go to your polling place to request a provisional ballot.
If you can't travel at all...
Call 833-728-6837 for live, personalized support.
DO I NEED ID TO VOTE IN PERSON?
In Pennsylvania, you are NOT required to show identification UNLESS it‚Äôs your first time voting at your current polling place.
If you are voting for the first time in a new location, you must show a valid form of identification‚Äîeven if you previously voted in PA but have since moved to a new precinct.
If you believe someone at your polling place has improperly or erroneously requested ID, please call PA Dems‚Äô Voter Assistance Hotline at 833-728-6837.
WHAT ARE MY VOTING RIGHTS?
Familiarize yourself with your voting rights before you hit the polls. Visit [[URL REDACTED]]
If you believe your rights have been violated, don't leave the polling place. Request a provisional ballot and immediately call PA Democrats' Voter Assistance Hotline: 833-728-6837.
* * *
For any other voting questions and concerns‚Äîor to report an issue at a polling place‚Äîcall the Voter Assistance Hotline at 1-833-728-6837.
You may also contact the state elections bureau at 1-877-868-3772 or [[URL REDACTED]]
* * *
NEED LIVE SUPPORT? Our Voter Assistance Hotline is staffed daily from now until Election Day. Call us!
1-833-PA-VOTES
(833-728-6837)
PAID FOR BY THE PENNSYLVANIA DEMOCRATIC PARTY. NOT AUTHORIZED BY ANY CANDIDATE OR CANDIDATE COMMITTEE. [[URL REDACTED]]

subject: Joe Biden is our nominee. Let's unite PA to elect him and Democrats at every level.
body_text:
I invite anyone who shares our values to join our team electing Democrats at every level in November. Add your name if you're with us in this fight!
PA Dems
Democrats,
Joe Biden is going to be our nominee to defeat Donald Trump and become the next President of the United States.
Senator Bernie Sanders has suspended his campaign, allowing our party to unite around Vice President Biden. I'm deeply grateful for Bernie and his supporters‚Äîand every presidential candidate whose ideas and coalitions have strengthened our cause!
Bernie's supporters should know there is always a place for their movement and ideas in the Democratic Party. Together, let's keep up the fight for progressive values like a living wage, quality healthcare, and a commonwealth that puts working people first.
I invite anyone who shares our values to join our team electing Democrats at every level in November. Add your name if you're with us in this fight!
* * *
I'M VOTING BLUE!
* * *
Joe Biden is an honest, decent man who will restore the voice of everyday people in the White House. As Vice President, he helped lift our economy from recession, rescue the auto industry, and extend healthcare to millions of people, including those with preexisting conditions.
Behind Joe, Democrats can expand healthcare access, fix our top-down economy, safeguard our elections, and create a safer, more equitable nation.
No president can do it alone, though! That's why we must remain focused on ALL of the battles ahead‚Äîlike flipping the PA legislature, expanding our US House majority, and re-electing our statewide officers.
The task ahead is bigger than any one candidate, election, or office. Our movement will be one to reshape Pennsylvania at every level, in every community, and for every voter.
Fellow Democrats, let's work as one to make Joe Biden president, flip the PA legislature, and secure sweeping Democratic victories at every level. Please sign on if you're ready to unite and lead PA Back To Blue!
Together we win,
Nancy Patton Mills
Chairwoman | PA Democratic Party
SIGN YOUR NAME

Republicans stepped up their organizing in a big way this weekend, and we need to respond in kind. Join the Back To Blue campaign today to instantly call Democratic voters from home.
PA Dems
Republicans stepped up their organizing in a big way this weekend, and we need to respond in kind. Join the Back To Blue campaign instantly to call Democratic voters from home right now.

Democrats,
The most unwelcome thing in my inbox all week was this email: a forwarded note from Team Trump outlining their plans to engage millions of supporters nationwide this weekend.
And I'll be honest: I have no doubt this weekend will be a big success for them.
All we can do is make sure that today, and every day from here until November, is just a little bit more productive for us. If we all work together, I have no doubt that will happen.
It will take everyone playing a part, though.
So team, we're calling on you to take action from home right now! Click here to start calling voters instantly‚Äîor pick from upcoming shifts happening today and on Tuesday.
Every call you make could bring us one vote closer to victory in November. Let's win this thing, together.

subject: Still have your ballot? You have options!
body_text:
If you requested a mail ballot but have not received it yet, you have two courses of action to ensure your vote is counted by November 3rd. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
We're counting on top Democrats like you to keep voters informed. After reading this update, please fwd/share it with all the PA Democrats you know.
Hey voters ‚Äî All mail ballots need to be in election officials' hands, or a dropbox, by 8 PM tonight. If you still have your ballot or never received it, you have three options to cast your vote!
* * *
Return it by hand to your county.
To avoid lines at the polls and ensure timely delivery, the best thing you can do with your ballot is return it in person! Take your ballot straight to your county's elections office, a dropbox, or a satellite voting center before 8 PM.
Note that dropboxes and elections offices close promptly at 8 PM, even if voters are still in line at that time.
FIND DROPOFF POINT
Vote at a polling place by "cancelling" your ballot.
If you have your ballot in hand but cannot get to a dropoff point, you may take the ballot and envelopes to your polling place to be cancelled. Then, you may vote on a machine as you normally would.
To prevent long lines to vote and added work for poll workers, we only recommend this option if you cannot reach a dropbox or elections office.
CONFIRM POLLING PLACE
Vote at a polling place with a provisional ballot.
If your ballot is missing, damaged, or cancelled, you may vote with a provisional ballot at your Election Day in-person polling place. All polling locations will be open 7 AM ‚Äì 8 PM.
CONFIRM POLLING PLACE
Request additional help if you can't travel.
Many voters are unable to visit an elections office or polling location due to limited mobility, medical reasons, and the risk of COVID-19. If that describes you or someone you care for, call 833-728-6837 to make a personalized plan based on your needs and location.
* * *
We do not recommend returning your ballot by mail after October 26th, as it may not be received in time.
* * *
NEED LIVE SUPPORT? Our Voter Assistance Hotline is staffed daily from now until Election Day. Call us!
1-833-PA-VOTES
(833-728-6837)

PA Dems
friends ‚Äî At a hearing of the PA General Assembly yesterday, GOP Representative Cris Dush made a truly vile remark likening Governor Wolf's COVID-19 response to the regimes of Hitler and Stalin.
‚ÄúMore and more, I go back to the German Democratic Nationalist Socialist Party, the Nazi Party. I go to the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, the USSR. This is a socialist playbook.‚Äù
A man who compares lifesaving mitigation efforts to the Holocaust and other crimes against humanity does not belong in state government, and party leaders who harbor him do not deserve the gavel.
Please make an urgent donation to replace Cris Dush and other Republican extremists with principled Democratic leaders.
* * *
If you've already saved your payment information with ActBlue Express, your contribution will be processed immediately:
$8$20$50$100OTHER
* * *
Sadly, Dush's remarks are just the latest in a long list of ridiculous GOP reactions to the ongoing pandemic:
MARCH 17
Speaker Mike Turzai refuses to postpone special elections despite social distancing measures, forcing voters to choose between their health and their vote.
MARCH 24
Rep. Stephanie Borowicz calls for a "Day of Humiliation and Prayer" and calls the coronavirus a ‚Äúpunishment inflicted upon us for our presumptuous sins.‚Äù
APRIL 15
Harrisburg Republicans vote to reopen PA businesses despite pleas from concerned workers and dire warnings from public health experts; Governor Wolf vetoes their reckless bill.
APRIL 20
GOP legislators attend far-right ‚ÄúRe-Open PA‚Äù protests in Harrisburg, ignoring public health experts and making various bizarre, misleading statements.
These actions make one thing very clear: The PA Republican Party welcomes extremists and science deniers no better than their failed leader in the White House.
If you donate today, we'll put your gift to work educating voters about the importance of flipping the PA House and PA Senate. Please contribute to end Republican extremism at the polls.

subject: The "field margin" that gave us Trump.
body_text:
Regardless of what national polls say, our internal indicators point to extremely tight races up and down the ballot. The voter YOU engage could very well be the deciding vote.
PA Dems
Hi Democrats,
In 2016, Donald Trump won Pennsylvania by just 44,292 votes out of 6,000,000+ ballots cast. That's a difference of 1/135 voters.
On the campaign trail, we call that a field margin: those few, make-or-break votes only won by mobilizing reluctant and deeply undecided voters. In 2020, it's on you and me to make sure we don't lose by the field margin again.
Take action this weekend ‚Äî and every day until polls close ‚Äî to help ensure Joe, Kamala, and Democrats down the ballot win the field margin!
* * *
PICK AN ACTION
* * *
There are lots of ways to help Democrats win over the next eighteen days. You can knock on doors. You can distribute voting materials. You can call or text voters from home.
Whichever way you choose to take action, your voice and your energy is needed!
Regardless of what national polls say, our internal indicators point to extremely tight races up and down the ballot. The voter YOU engage could very well be the deciding vote.
Pick a way to take action this weekend, and let's go win every last vote we can!
Let's win this,
Jason Henry
Executive Director
PA Democratic Party

subject: Trump's suing PA over mail-in voting. We're suing right back.
body_text:
The fight for free and fair elections is escalating quickly in PA, and we need to raise a huge sum of money to fight back ASAP. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Democrats ‚Äî The fight for free and fair elections amid a global pandemic is escalating quickly here in PA.
FIRST, Governor Wolf and a bipartisan coalition of legislators passed mail-in voting in PA, and our Vote By Mail campaign helped over one million Democrats vote from home in the PA Primary.
THEN, Donald Trump and PA Republicans got scared. They sued to throw out votes and make mail-in voting harder this fall.
NOW, we're taking the fight right back to them, with a countersuit of our own and the biggest voter protection team PA has ever seen.

subject: How to vote if your mail ballot is missing or damaged.
body_text:
If you were approved for a mail ballot you're unable to return, request a provisional ballot at your assigned polling place on Primary Day. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
Voters ‚Äî In Pennsylvania's first ever election with no-excuse mail voting, our state and local election officials have performed incredibly.
They safely delivered an unexpected surge of over a million ballots and established well over one hundred ballot dropoff locations statewide, all while navigating several crises and resistance from some GOP leaders.
Still, we recognize that in some rare cases mail ballots were damaged or didn't arrive in time. Rest assured ‚Äî If you were approved for a mail ballot you can not return, you may still vote by requesting a provisional ballot at your assigned polling place.
* * *
HOW TO VOTE WITH A PROVISIONAL BALLOT
FIND YOUR ASSIGNED POLLING PLACE
VOTER ASSISTANCE HOTLINE: 833-728-6837
* * *
We understand voting in person is not ideal, and we only ask that you do so if you feel entirely safe. We don't recommend voting in person if you feel sick, or if anyone in your household has a severe health issue.
If you do decide to vote in person, here are some ways you can protect yourself and others at the polls:
1. Wear a mask at all times while at the polling place.
2. Wash your hands immediately before and after voting.
3. Bring your own pen (black or blue ballpoint) to fill in the provisional ballot.
4. Vote during low-traffic periods, such as the mid-morning or mid-afternoon, if your schedule allows it.
5. Be mindful of personal space. Limit your contact and try to keep six feet between you and other people.
If you have any additional questions about casting a provisional ballot, please call our Voter Support Hotline: 1-833-PAVOTES. Voting advocates will be standing by for your calls until 9 PM tonight and all day on Primary Day.
We'll spend the next several months working diligently to make Vote By Mail run even smoother in the fall. For now, please make your voice heard by heading to your assigned polling location tomorrow and requesting a Provisional Ballot.
Kindest regards,
Kay Yu
Voter Protection Director
PA Democratic Party
* * *
HOW TO VOTE WITH A PROVISIONAL BALLOT
FIND YOUR ASSIGNED POLLING PLACE
VOTER ASSISTANCE HOTLINE: 833-728-6837
* * *

body_text:
With the primary postponed and in-person voting likely limited, we're still working hard to help thousands of PA voters request, fill out, and return mail-in ballots for the very first time! - - - - -
PA Dems
Team ‚Äî By the time the calendar flipped to May, the PA Primary was supposed to be over and our candidates known. Then came COVID-19, social distancing, and a postponed election...
Now, with the primary still weeks away and in-person voting likely limited, we're putting all we can into helping PA voters request and return mail-in ballots for the very first time!
That isn't quite what we planned for, but it's what we have to do to protect the vote and win. At this key moment, can you contribute $20.20 to help extend and expand our primary campaign?
* * *
INSTANT DONATE $20.20
or donate another amount
* * *
A longer primary season brings surprise financial pitfalls as well.
It means funds meant for November are being spent to turn out votes in May, and it leaves our eventual candidates with less time to campaign, fundraise, and unite our party behind them.
We're responding by increasing our April and May funding goals in a big way. As the lead organization supporting every Democrat on the ballot, it's on us to lay the foundation to win.
If you can, friends, please chip in an extra $20.20 to meet our new financial goals and sustain our Vote By Mail efforts!

Catherine McParland

subject: How to vote if your mail ballot has not arrived.
body_text:
If you requested a mail ballot but have not received it yet, you have two courses of action to ensure your vote is counted by November 3rd. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PA Dems
We're counting on top Democrats like you to keep voters informed. After reading this update, please fwd/share it with all the PA Democrats you know.
Hey voters ‚Äî If you requested a mail ballot but have not received it yet, rest assured that your vote can still be counted! In fact, you have several different options to make your voice heard.
* * *
Request a replacement ballot in person.
Most Pennsylvania voters who did not receive their approved mail ballot can request a new one in person. Head to your county elections office or satellite voting center by Monday, November 2nd. Call us at 833-728-6837 if you can't find your office or its hours!
FIND ELECTIONS OFFICE
Vote November 3rd with a provisional ballot.
If you're not able to claim a replacement ballot in person, you may still vote with a provisional ballot on Election Day. To do so, please go to your assigned polling place and ask for a provisional ballot on November 3rd; the polls will be open 7 AM ‚Äì 8 PM.
CONFIRM POLLING PLACE
Request additional help if you can't travel.
Many voters are unable to visit an elections office or polling location due to limited mobility, medical reasons, and the risk of COVID-19. If that describes you or someone you care for, call 833-728-6837 to make a personalized plan based on your needs and location.
* * *
Already received your ballot?
If you've already received your ballot, the information above does not apply to you. Please mark your ballot, seal it in the secrecy and return envelopes, and complete and sign the Voter Declaration before returning it in person to your county dropbox or elections office.
FIND DROPOFF POINTS
We do not recommend returning your ballot by mail after October 26th, as it may not be received in time.
* * *
NEED LIVE SUPPORT? Our Voter Assistance Hotline is staffed daily from now until Election Day. Call us!
1-833-PA-VOTES
(833-728-6837)
PAID FOR BY THE PENNSYLVANIA DEMOCRATIC PARTY. NOT AUTHORIZED BY ANY CANDIDATE OR CANDIDATE COMMITTEE. [[URL REDACTED]]

Through Pennsylvania's first ever Vote By Mail campaign, PA Dems are building a HUGE advantage that could make all the difference this fall. To date, more than 850,000 Democrats have signed up to vote from home‚Äîrelative to just 400,000 Republicans.
Our 450,000+ ballot advantage has state Republicans on edge and has drawn attention from Reuters, who attributed the gap to Trump's Vote By Mail conspiracy theories. They give him too much credit, though.

subject: Hope, unity, and action.
body_text:
Sign up to take action this weekend, and together let's win this fight for the soul of our nation by electing Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.
PA Dems
Wow, team! What a week.
We heard inspiring, sometimes heartbreaking, stories from Americans of every background, color, age, creed, and identity.
We made history and shattered glass ceilings when we nominated Kamala Harris as the first Black woman on a presidential ticket.
We officially named Joseph R. Biden, son of Scranton, our Democratic nominee to unite America and restore the soul of our nation!
And all week long, Pennsylvanians told us over and over: "I finally feel like I have hope."
Friends, we can't let this energy fizzle. Let's take this hope and love and energy and channel it into the biggest weekend of action that Pennsylvania has ever seen!
Volunteer this weekend to help unite America behind Joe Biden, Kamala Harris, and Democrats at every level.
There are only 75 days until polls close on November 3rd. What we do with those days will quite literally determine the type of nation we are to become.
And we need you, friends. Even if you hate making phone calls. Even if technology gives you fits. Even if you swear that you can't make a difference. You can.
You can be the difference between four more years of hate and lies or renewed hope for America.
Sign up to take action this weekend, and together let's win this Fight for the Soul of Our Nation by electing Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.

PA Dems
Hey folks,
The weather is cool and crisp. The foliage is gorgeous. And Democrats all over PA are making a triumphant return to knocking doors ‚Äî with safety and social distancing measures in place!
Many of you have been eagerly awaiting a safe return to in-person voter contact, and now that time has come! Sign up tonight to knock doors and talk with voters about Joe, Kamala, and down-ballot Dems this weekend.

SIGN UP TO CANVASS
* * *
Safety has been a top concern for our organizing team all year, and we're taking five key steps to make knocking doors safe and comfortable for volunteers and voters alike:
1) Training every volunteer on COVID-19 safety
2) Requiring symptom surveys & temperature checks
3) Closely following CDC, state, and local guidance
4) Providing masks/PPE free of charge
5) Notifying voters when canvassers may arrive
And if you have limited mobility or are in a high-risk group, we still have plenty of virtual ways to get involved! Click here to call or text voters from home.
With under four weeks left until Election Day, it's on every last one of us to do the most we can. The Soul of Our Nation depends on it.
Go to [[URL REDACTED]] to turn Pennsylvania back to blue by knocking doors and talking to voters! Flexible shifts are available from now until Election Day.
Thank you,
Lavianna Felder
"Get Out The Vote" Director
Back To Blue PA
