body_text:
Sign up to take action this weekend, and together let's win this fight for the soul of our nation by electing Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.
PA Dems
Democrats,
The Republican Party is using its national convention to paint a dark and disjointed picture of America. With each extreme speaker they roll out, the GOP further falsifies our agenda, rewrites Trump's dismal record, and papers over the crises gripping our nation.
It's enough to make you want to scream, but screaming won't help end this national nightmare. Only organizing can do that!
The best way to counter RNC lies is to commit to having hard conversations in your community. Volunteer this weekend to talk with voters near you about the Democrats on their ballot!
* * *
TAKE ACTION ‚Üí
* * *
There are under 70 days until polls close on November 3rd and under three weeks until early votes are cast.
That means we have extremely limited time to set the record straight and show swing voters what Dems really stand for: justice, equality, and a better life for ALL people.
You can be the difference between four more years of these hate and lies or renewed hope for America.
Sign up to take action this weekend, and together let's win this Fight for the Soul of Our Nation by electing Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.
Onward,
Jason Henry

subject: September Recap
body_text:
Friends,
We‚Äôre about to enter October, the most important month of the election cycle. Our efforts these final 35 days will determine whether or not we flip the Pennsylvania House of Representatives on November 3rd.
This month, you heard from Lt. Governor John Fetterman, Treasurer Joe Torsella, and United States Senator Cory Booker on why flipping the Pennsylvania House is so important this November. As many of you know, we only need to flip 9 seats to flip the state house for only the second time since 2000. Our races are getting national attention because of your support!
Earlier this month we participated in a Day of Action with the most important legislative chambers in the country to highlight our key down ballot races. Groups from Washington, DC to California are chipping in to help us flip the Pennsylvania House of Representatives. On our day of giving, grassroots support came from across the nation -- the average contribution was less than 24 dollars.
Tomorrow is our final fundraising reporting deadline before Election Day. We need to raise $4,786 in less than 48 hours to reach our goal. Whether it‚Äôs $100.00 or $10.00, your support goes directly to the local Democrats in Pennsylvania that need it the most. We can do this, but we need your support.
Thank you,
Leanne Krueger
Chair, PA HDCC

subject: Republicans hope you miss this email

Deadline -- Wednesday, September 30 at 11:59:00 P.M.
Bad news -- We need to raise $3,876 before MIDNIGHT tonight.
The third quarter ends tonight at 11:59 PM. This is our final quarterly fundraising deadline before Election Day on November 3rd. We need to raise $3,876 before October 1st in order to enter the final 30 days of the campaign strong.
Republicans and their Washington allies have spent millions of dollars attacking and lying about our members and candidates on TV. They know they are misleading and manipulating voters. House Republicans will do anything to hold their power in Harrisburg, even if it means distorting the records and accomplishments of our members and candidates.
The money you donate stays in Pennsylvania and will be used to stop the negative Republican smear campaign. We need to set the record straight\--and to do that, we need the resources to communicate. If we miss this goal, we will enter the final month of the campaign with limited resources to reach voters as they are making their final decisions. Republicans know that our pathway to a Democratic majority depends on grassroots contributions. They are hoping that you‚Äôll miss this deadline!
Thank you for your continued support as we enter the final month of this campaign!
Dena Gleason

subject: The Blue Wave is coming to the Keystone State
body_text:
You are receiving this email because of your support for electing Democrats up and down the ballot. The Pennsylvania House Democratic Campaign Committee is dedicated to flipping the state House blue and making positive change for working Pennsylvanians. If you would rather not receive emails from us, please unsubscribe.
Good morning, folks ‚Äì
Our team is working on the front lines to elect Democrats, but corporate special interests and high-dollar Republican donors try to undercut us at every turn.
But I‚Äôve got three pieces of really good news.
1. In 2018, we won BIG: we flipped 14 seats in the Pennsylvania House. Ten years ago, a victory like that was unimaginable.
2. We won the popular vote by a LANDSLIDE. That means that we already have a huge base of strong Democrats like you, who can join us to win in 2020.
3. We can flip the House if we win 9 more seats. Let me repeat that: Nine. More. Seats. That‚Äôs all it takes to win a majority and make real change for working families in Pennsylvania.
For the first time in a long time, we have a clear path toward winning this race. But we‚Äôll need to buckle down, work smart, and get every single Democrat (like you!) on our team.
We don‚Äôt have a minute to waste.
So, are you in? Chip in a few dollars to our FLIP 2020 FUND:
Donate $20 Donate $50
Donate $100 Donate $500
Donate $2500 Other Amount
Let‚Äôs do this.
Gavin Lichtenstein
Digital Director

subject: A coal miner‚Äôs son from Clarks Summit
body_text:
You are receiving this email because of your support for electing Democrats up and down the ballot. The Pennsylvania House Democratic Campaign Committee is dedicated to flipping the state House blue and making positive change for working Pennsylvanians. If you would rather not receive emails from us, please unsubscribe.
Dear friends,
I‚Äôm a miner‚Äôs son from Clarks Summit, PA. My dad passed away suddenly when I was 7, leaving my mom Bessie to raise five children alone. She worked hard to put food on the table and raise us well.
I ended up earning a scholarship to Columbia where I played football and later married my law school sweetheart. Early in my career, I served as a Public Defender in Dauphin County and an Assistant District Attorney in Allegheny County, getting a first-hand look at all sides of our legal system.
Now that I‚Äôm the Democratic Leader of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives, I know I‚Äôll never forget where I came from.
Every one of my colleagues has a story like this: a home town, a working family, a reason they‚Äôre in this fight. It‚Äôs our job to represent our neighbors, the people who keep this state going, the folks who don‚Äôt feel like they have a seat at the table.
We get it. Because we‚Äôve been there.
Our House Democratic Campaign Committee is working around the clock to flip the House blue so we can make real, positive changes for regular folks ‚Äì not big business and special interests.
We don‚Äôt have a long list of wealthy donors, so we need your support. Will you chip in $5 to stand with us?
Donate $5

Donate $100
Other Amount
Always fighting for you,
Frank Dermody

subject: Their playbook has one page: obstruction
body_text:
Dear Friend --
My name is Austin Davis. In 2018, I became the first African American to represent Pennsylvania‚Äôs 35th District in the state house.
I‚Äôm reaching out from Harrisburg because I need your help.
As a member of the House Appropriations Committee, I help shape our state‚Äôs budget. Every day, I fight to strengthen unions and worker protections, fairly fund public schools and increase Pre-K access, and build an equitable and just future for Allegheny County.
I am proud of the progress we have made. But I know how much more we could do with a Democratic majority.
Will you chip in $20.20 to flip the House? ‚Üí
The Republican Party in our state has one priority: obstruction.
Wasting taxpayer time and money. Throwing away good ideas. Blocking Governor Wolf‚Äôs proposals. This is their playbook.
And they say WE don‚Äôt get things done!
My friend, if we‚Äôre going to move Pennsylvania forward -- if we‚Äôre going to raise the minimum wage, reform criminal justice, pass LGBTQ protections, and hold corporations accountable -- we need to fire the time-wasters and elect real leaders instead.
Donate $20
Donate $50
Donate $2500
Donate $35
Donate $500
Other Amount
And for the first time in years, we‚Äôre within striking distance!
That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm asking you, my friend: will you chip in to the Pennsylvania House Democratic Campaign Committee to flip the house and elect a Democratic majority?
From the districts Trump carried in 2016, to those rapidly shifting blue, we are committed to winning this fight together.
But we need to come together NOW if we‚Äôre going to pull it off. I‚Äôm counting on you.
Together,
Rep. Austin Davis
Pennsylvania District 35

Every dollar that we raise is going right back out the door to reach undecided voters who will likely be making their final decision on Election Day.
Don‚Äôt pay attention to the polls -- House Republicans still have a strong shot at holding onto their majority in the state house. A decade ago, Republicans drew gerrymandered maps in these districts so they would never lose control of their majority -- we are simply just going against the odds.
In the final week, we are running out of time to reach voters in our most valuable and important seats across PA. I know making a financial contribution is a BIG ask, but your support has never been needed more. Across Pennsylvania, people are voting as we speak for Democrats up and down the ballot. Who we send to Washington and Harrisburg will impact every community, city, and town in Pennsylvania. I need Democratic allies and partners in the state house who will join me in making corporations pay their fair share in taxes, passing protections for the LGBTQ community, and finally increasing the minimum wage for the first time in over 15 years. I am proud of the work we have accomplished together since I was elected in 2014. From investing in our public schools to expanding access to health care -- we have made clear that our values as Democrats support working families across Pennsylvania to move our commonwealth forward.

Senator Jim Brewster has been serving Pennsylvanians for twenty-five years - first on McKeesport City Council, then as Mayor of McKeesport, and for the past ten years as state Senator.

In the Senate, Jim has sponsored legislation that has brought education funding to his district and infrastructure investments to revitalize post-industrial communities. He has continued to be a leader during the ever-changing crisis, prioritizing the security of our communities and workers, and introducing plans to exempt federal stimulus payments from state and local taxes.
We need Jim Brewster in the Senate to keep fighting for us in Allegheny and Westmoreland Counties.

subject: A dangerous proposal
body_text:
Friend,
This week Republicans in the Senate passed SB613, which would have allowed non-essential businesses to reopen in the midst of this pandemic. I‚Äôll be frank - Republicans don‚Äôt want to reopen the economy because they are worried about working families, they want to support the bottom lines of the same corporate interests that line their campaign coffers. This is a failure of leadership and why we are working so hard to flip the Senate this year.
[Will you contribute $5 or $10 now to help us flip the Senate?]
Friend, this bill is nothing short of dangerous. Re-opening businesses too soon poses a serious health risk to employees, consumers, and our health care systems. That‚Äôs why experts, nurses, and scientists oppose this dangerous legislation. We know times are hard for a lot of folks out there right now, but the solution cannot include putting corporate interests ahead of people‚Äôs lives.
Our caucus is focused on legislation such as The American Working Family Relief Action Plan, child care assistance, eviction and foreclosure protection for disaster emergencies and more, and concentrating on mitigating the unprecedented health crisis facing us.
We can flip the Senate this year, and doing so would mean that we have a majority to fight for all of this legislation and more to enact real change for citizens of the Commonwealth. Please contribute whatever you can now to support flipping the Senate this year.
Thank you.
Senator Jay Costa
Democratic Leader, PA State Senate

subject: Your vote is protected
body_text:
Friend,
You might have seen what happened in Wisconsin this month - voters had to choose between going out to vote and risking their health or staying home and not having their voice count.
I‚Äôm happy to report, this will not happen this year in Pennsylvania. We implemented new vote by mail regulations in late 2019 to make voting more convenient and secure than ever before. This means that your vote and voice will be counted without you having to choose between your health and exercising your right to vote.
Here‚Äôs what you need to know:
1\. The primary election date has been moved to JUNE 2, 2020.
2\. Pennsylvania now allows no excuse mail in voting.
3\. Your application for a mail-in ballot must be received by your county office by 5:00PM on MAY 26, 2020.
4\. Your returned mail-in ballot must be returned by 8:00 PM on JUNE 2, 2020.
Your voice, your vote, and your health are protected this year.
Apply for your mail-in ballot, or find more information about mail-in versus absentee ballots by visiting: [[URL REDACTED]]
Thank you for continuing to make your voice heard.
Senator Jay Costa

We have 20 days until Election Day and we have a lot of work to do. In addition to taking back the White House and flipping the United States Senate, we must also pay close attention to legislative races on the ballot this November.
Supporting down-ballot Democrats is my mission, because I have been there. I know how important and critical local elected officials are to a community and a district. This year, I am rolling up my sleeves to support local Democrats running for legislatures across the country, and Pennsylvania is at the top of my list!

As Democrats, every issue we care about from healthcare to wages to infrastructure to public school funding is on the ballot this November. body_text:
Friend,
There are so many issues that make this fall‚Äôs elections the most consequential in our lifetime. From healthcare to the environment to gun violence prevention -- who you send to Harrisburg to represent you matters. And the stakes are even higher this year because the elected officials you choose at the state level will draw electoral maps that will be in place for the next 10 years.
After my time as U.S. Attorney General during the Obama Administration, I launched the National Democratic Redistricting Committee (NDRC) and committed to fight gerrymandering because I saw first-hand how it stalled an agenda focused on the needs of the people. Our team at the NDRC is determined to end this practice of politicians manipulating maps. We fundamentally believe that voters should choose their representatives ‚Äì not the other way around where politicians pick their voters.
Because of Republican investments and strategies a decade ago, Pennsylvania spent most of the past decade as one of the most gerrymandered states in the country. If we are going to secure fair maps for the next decade, we need to elect a Democratic majority to the Pennsylvania House of Representatives this fall.
That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm asking you to chip in $30 to the Pennsylvania House Democratic Campaign Committee today. It‚Äôll show you‚Äôve taken a stand against Republican gerrymandering.
Donate $20
Donate $50
Donate $2500
Donate $35
Donate $500
Other Amount
Earlier this year, the NDRC endorsed 21 candidates and members running for the Pennsylvania House of Representatives. Prior to receiving our endorsement, each candidate took a pledge to stand against gerrymandering.
With your help, we will elect a Democratic majority and ensure we end gerrymandering in Pennsylvania for good.
Eric H. Holder, Jr.
82nd Attorney General of the United States
Chairman of the National Democratic Redistricting Committee
Paid for by Pennsylvania House Democratic Campaign Committee
PA HDCC
PO Box 555
Harrisburg PA 17108 United States
